Reviews.Title: “great option when visiting universal”
Reviews.Author: DoubleShotMargarita
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel once the mean woman behind the desk got our room right. this is one of my fave chains. the rooms are somewhat modern with huge tv's and a nice livingroom area in each room. had to sleep in two double beds for one night until the king room we actually booked two months in advance was ready. breakfast is great, tazo, starbucks, yogurt, fruit from a can lol... can they at least put fresh pineapple instead if that elementary fruit cocktail please :) otherwise apples and bananas were readily available. quick safe walk to the park. had a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Hyatt Place Universal!”
Reviews.Author: angelo885
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in 2007 and really liked it. We had a wedding to attend north of Orlando and decided to come down a few days early to go to Universal again. This time we were a group of 9 and we recommended staying here. Everyone was very pleased with the size of the rooms, the staff, breakfast buffet and shuttle to the park. Debbie at the front desk.....just as sweet as 4 1/2 years ago! Paul the manager is also a pleasure to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place is a hit!”
Reviews.Author: LindaWickert
Reviews.Content: Always clean and comfy rooms, great beds and pillows and very attentive staff and great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: soxfan00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right of Major Blvd. Rooms are clean, beds and bathrooms are in great shape. Staff was helpful and quick to check-in. Asked for a high floor and got ground floor - but thats a personal preference. Decor much nicer (and modern) than the Holiday Inn and Comfort Suites in the same area. Breakfast was ok for the type of hotel, atmosphere and selection was good. Above the usual for the hotels of this type. You can walk to Universal (15min) or $5.00 cab ride

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Visit Universal”
Reviews.Author: s0krm0m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night and was extremely impressed. We tried to check in early and weren't able. The front desk staff was very kind and offered to call as soon as a room was ready. The room was very large, had free wi-fi, and a large TV. The room was spotless and nicely decorated. They offered a variety of connections to the tv as well. The breakfast though crowded (there was a dance competition in town) was very good and filling. I would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, affordable hotel with great location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: Mayday44
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hyatt Place hotels before and have yet to be disappointed. The rooms are huge (almost like a suite), spotless, modern and comfortable. The service has always been great and the Orlando location was no exception. The woman at the front desk helped resolve some issues with my Hyatt points and was very friendly. The location is great for getting to Universal. I disagree with other reviewers stating that it is not safe or close enough to walk. We walked (granted it is almost a mile but I live in a big city so maybe I'm just used to walking!) and the neighborhood is perfectly safe. The hotel does offer a free shuttle but with limited times that didn't work for us. The hotel does have a nice pool but certainly not like the themed Disney pools. If you are looking for a full-service, full-amenity hotel then this place is probably not for you. However, if you want an affordable option for Universal that provides excellent rooms and service then you can't beat Hyatt Place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: munslowl
Reviews.Content: Family of five staying for 8 nights. Helpful staff. Kids love the pool. Short walk to Universal. Reasonable breakfast buffet. Used points so can't comment on ale for money.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice if you cannot afford to stay at Disney or Universal....”
Reviews.Author: DennisPreston
Reviews.Content: Very friendly place to stay with comfortable beds and a great sitting area in our king sized room. Debbie at the front desk went out of her way to be friendly and very helpful. Overall, if you cannot afford to stay at Disney or Universal...this is a great option. I recommend planning to take the shuttle cause after a day wandering the theme parks you will not feel inclined to walk ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Right Near Universal Studios Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FSUKXAZ
Reviews.Content: Whenever I go back to Orlando (I used to live there), which is at least 6 times per year, I usually try to stay at Hyatt Place. It is a boutique hotel by the Hyatt brand. If you've stayed at a Hyatt Place, this is just like all the others: 42" plasma flat screen TV, couch, ottoman, granite counter tops, wet bar, fridge, desk, leather chair, wireless internet, comfy beds, large room, a pool, a free breakfast, etc. I was there in September 2011 to go see Blue Man Group for my birthday. What separates this particular Hyatt Place is that it sits right across the street from Universal Studios and City Walk. There is a TGI Fridays within walking distance of the hotel. I've stayed there a few times. It's convenient to Kirkman Rd, I-4, and I-Drive.

Reviews.Title: “What a jewel!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSparrow
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. Our first experience with a Hyatt Place, and we were not disappointed. We stayed 2 nights, but will stay longer when in the area again. Wonderful staff, very accomodating, very clean etc. Wonderful breakfast which is comp, a good mix of continental and hot items. The first I have seen for a limited service hotel was the 24 hr cafe for sandwiches etc., on site, and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: BURGESS-IN-VA
Reviews.Content: This place is a true gem! Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Spotlessly clean rooms. Comfortable beds!! LARGE rooms! I can't say enough good things about this hotel. When we return to Orlando, this is the only place we will stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: BabaTabo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Friendly staff, great breakfast, huge rooms, big flat screen TV and great location. Have nothing negative to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: GGM_PGA
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the hotel for a few days last week while I attended a conference. Hotel was nice. Rooms are VERY VERY large. The hotel was out of Kings so my wife and I had to stay in a 2 bed room, but I am telling you if you have little ones the 2 bed room with the pull out would absolutely sleep 4 NO prob with plenty of room to spare. Only a few minor things... 1st if you stay there over a weekend GET A TOP FLOOR ROOM. We heard kids running laps around the room above us all frigin night (the desk took care of it but only after I called them at midnight). 2nd the couch was in very bad need of replacement. The cushions were severly "injured" making the couch pretty darn uncomfortable. 3rd the bathroom is terribly small. I think the clearance between the tip of the toilet and the door was maybe (and I really mean maybe) 1/4 of an inch. When I opened the door I had to step into the shower so that I could turn around and close the door. Not that big a deal but really made me laugh everytime I went to use the restroom. Overall it was a very good experience and the location is really close to just about everything. I would absolutely stay here again. Staff was great... Just make sure you get a top floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for universal studios stay”
Reviews.Author: vicky53cardiff
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay and greatly enjoyed the hotel. The room was spacious and having a fridge was good. Although many of previous reviews had mentioned negative comments none take away from this being great value. Free WiFi, parking and a great breakfast make this a very good place to stay. All the staff were unfailingly cheerful and helpful. We walked to and from the universal a number of times and even when we took a taxi it was cheap.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: prairieswan
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in November during a trip to Disney/Universal and we really enjoyed our stay. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, willing to help and accomodate requests - following the high standards I expect with a Hyatt hotel. We made use of the small snack/coffee bar in the evenings, and enjoyed the continental breakfast. They had a good variety of food, however, could add some hard boiled eggs or a protein option. There is a breakfast menu if you want more than what's offered. Our room/beds were extremely comfortable! We would definitely stay here again! There is a TGI Fridays close by - with great food and friendly staff. A bit further down the road (within walking distance) there is a Walgreens and a 'buffet' style restaurant that is decently priced ($12) had has a large variety, and a few other pubs/restaurants. We utilized the shuttle to Universal (5 in drive) as well as to Disney (about 45 min drive), the shuttle drivers were extremely friendly and accomodating. Our flight home left at 5pm, they took us to Universal in the morning, picked us up at 2pm, drove us back to the hotel to get our bags and then took us to the airport (for less than what a cab would have charged). We also used the iRide Trolley to get to and from the Outlet malls - just $2 per trip, and takes about 45 min.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good location”
Reviews.Author: RogerFromBrazil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a real estate - hunting trip to the Orlando region. Rooms are very nice and staff is extremely helpful. Will stay again on returning to region. Being close to Universal was a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: roamer9876
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Universal and the nice city walk along the canal. Decent pool. Not too much great food nearby, but there is a Friday's next door if you are desperate. Rooms were clean and pretty big and I liked the area with the couch for watching TV. The beds are terrible, way too soft and no support. Bedspread seemed like it doesn't get washed enough. Gave 3 stars instead of 4 because of the beds. Probably will try a different hotel if I am in Orlando again mostly because of the bed issue.

Reviews.Title: “The Toilet ruined my stay here!”
Reviews.Author: 123mary321
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from 12/25-12/30/2011. The hotel was very nice, it smelled good the layout was small but very cute, the employees were very helpful and nice. The room was good, the couch pull out bed was very useful, the beds were soft everything was good, except for the toilet, even the small bathroom didn't bother me, the toilet would not flush right, it would get clogged up with just toilet paper, we called the front desk and someone came to "fix it" and after they left i tested it by simply flushing it and it worked, then i blew my nose and flushed the toilet paper down and it got clogged again....there was not a trash can in the bathroom to suggest that toilet paper shouldn't be flushed. They were nice about offering a different room but we decided not to move since we were always short on time we just didn't care to and just asked for a plunger to be kept in our room. checking in and out was fast, we didn't try the breakfast free buffet but it looked good. I would not recommend the Friday's down the street, it was a bad experience and not worth the wait. Double tree is on the other side of the street and on the right of that hotel you will find a Wallgreens which was helpful when we went to go buy water and snacks for our stay since our room had a mini fridge (a total plus :) ) and there is also a really good restaurant that is better for the money and the food is excellent i is called Orlando Ale House, its in the same shopping center. We did not have a car so we found this to be very convenient. It was a 15 min walk from Hyatt. and to be honest the food and price was better than most high priced city walk restaurants. Also a cab to Universal was only 5-7 dollars including tip, which was affordable with 2 kids and especially after a long day of theme park walking...Overall this hotel was really good the location was good and the staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you are here for Universal”
Reviews.Author: rs2512
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in the past week. Now to reality, this is one of the bad Hyatt hotels that we have stayed. Firstly the bed was horrible. When the person lying next to you lifts head, the frame creaks and your side of the bed goes down. So let alone turning and tossing. Extremely uncomfy to sleep in two consecutive nights in that bed.The rooms are thin as air. You can hear your neighbor's shower or people walking across corridor etc. Bathroom space is freaky, you literally need to sneak in. Free breakfast.. actually not so much of a breakfast. They had standard packaged cereal boxes, old bread variety (english muffin, bagel), nothing cooked in the menu like eggs. They "proudly" brew Starbucks but the coffee served with bf was inedible. To the better things - the room was spacious.. separate living and bed areas, nice big 55" TV, proximity to Universal. Seriously you can walk to the park. TGI is the only restaurant close by, if you want to escape the room service from Hyatt's kitchen. Good stuff in Bfast was choice of fruits including fresh fruits, cut fruit bar, juices etc. Except for the studio proximity, nothing great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and comfortable sleep”
Reviews.Author: Everettd
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect for a visit to Universal as they provide shuttle service to the park. This isn't a resort but a clean place to sleep.The beds are very comfy with very nice linens and pillows. Our room was like a mini suite with a seperate area with a frig and sofa, etc. My only complaint about the room was the bath..very poor design you could hardly open the bathroom door to get in..The toliet was at the door blocking entrance..I was amazed that they didnt design this better..almost like a Super 8 and no place with a HYATT name.. The bathroom sink was outside the bath area which was nice, but they really didnt plan this well. We had a view from our top floor room(floor 7) of the Universal Park and could clearly see Hogwart Castle from our room. I was taken back some when I mentioned this to those working the front desk and they assured me that was impossible. How could they be so mis informed as you can see the castle and many of the rides from our hotel window. They have a descent breakfast but nothing hot except toast..no danish, cinnamon rolls , only donuts .It would have been nice if they invested into a waffle maker and some nice pastries. Why they don't? Easy..they sell them extra for a insane price. The coffee was great however and all that I enjoyed. So, unless you are into cereal, runny oatmeal(awlful). and toast and powered donuts, just crab some coffee and forget this breakfast..I've had better at Comfort Inns even.. So, comfy beds, great location, shuttle service, free internet and parking and good price makes this a good choice. I must say , however, didn't feel like any Hyatt I have ever stayed in...more like a Holiday InnExpress or Hampton inn feel!! But, a good sleep and location serves the purpose..

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled but not new. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: LLKMiami
Reviews.Content: Nice place. User friendly updated rooms. Big TVs. Good breakfast bar. Unexpected bar in the lobby for a quick drink without leaving the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: C_Cheung52
Reviews.Content: I read all the previous reviews and have had good luck staying at recommended hotels. I was surprised at the Hyatt Place. The room was comfortable but the couch was something I would not sit on without a cover. It could have used some cleaning. The room set up was good. The bathroom was the best part. Clean and great shower. After flushing the toilet there would be a scary creepy noise about 5 minutes later. The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired. Crowded, crowded, crowded and food was gone before they could replenish. We ended up going to IHOP afterwards. I have stayed at other hotels in Orlando that are better for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel, but don't leave anything behind.”
Reviews.Author: debjojo
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed the night at Hyatt place, after spending a wonderful day at Universal Studios. The hotel is across the street from the park, which is very convenient. The hotel and room was spotless and very modern... They serve complimentary Breakfast, and had many choices, Bagels, Oatmeal, cereal, doughnuts and juices. I just have one complaint, I forgot my phone charger in my room when I checked out, and my 6 year old neice left her stuffed animal behind in my brother's room, We called the next day, and housekeeping said they could not find either items, the stuffed animal was in her BED, and my phone charger was by the sink, how could you not FIND these items, try telling that to a small child after just getting it from universal studios... That's bad business. Housekeeping should keep all lost items in a safe place in case people call for them, we called less than 24 hours after noticing these items were not packed... So PLEASE, check your rooms real good before you leave, because you won't get them back.

Reviews.Title: “Prefect”
Reviews.Author: candy_kain
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was great and the room was very clean. Although the fridge didn't work causing myself and my sister in law to become slightly ill due to eating cheesecake that was in the warm refrigerator, the staff took care of the inconvenience. Overall my trip was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here summer 2010 (late review) It was excellent off the main strip across the road from universal. Suited us as we rented a car, which I would recommend doing in Orlando as all parks are pretty much no where near each other. Nothing is walking distance! We did them all from here, went to universal more frequently due to location for dinner as there lots of restaurants. The hotel was very clean very modern amenities and excellent helpfull/friendly staff. We stayed a week and enjoyed it. Good breakfast options too! 4 star quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff...”
Reviews.Author: firefighteru7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here more than once b/c I love it. The rooms are all updated, the staff is great, the free continental breakfast is wonderful & its right across from Universal Studios. I can't say enough great things about this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for visiting Universal”
Reviews.Author: evil_lina
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in Orlando for just three days, primarily to visit Universal. Not wanting to pay the high rates for on-site hotels I found this little gem right across the street from the entrance to the Universal property. I couldn't have picked a better location. Every day we walked from the hotel to City Walk, a short 10- to 15-minute walk with pedestrian crosswalks and lights to guide us across each street. We didn't even bother to look into the free shuttle as walking suited us just fine. The inexpensive iRide trolley near the hotel was easy to use and took us right to the outlet mall. The hotel itself has a nice, modern vibe and felt clean throughout. The staff were very friendly, greeting us each time we came in the door. Free continental breakfast was what you usually find for free in a chain hotel. Nothing to write home about but all the basics you could need. The room was large, the beds comfortable with lots of plush pillows, and the complimentary toiletries had a lovely scent. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jay M
Reviews.Content: The location is great for those visiting Universal Studios and the Outlet Malls. The free shuttle will get you to Universal plenty early and it's a $10 cab fare to outlet malls. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Complimentary breakfast is what you would expect and there's no sit down restaurant on site but there's 24 room service which is reasonably priced (and good). We had a comfortable king sized bed, big flat screen tv, everything was clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfectly modern and comfy to suit any size family.”
Reviews.Author: Dasey83
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt has been remodeled recently giving the hotel a modern flare. We reserved a king room online and was given a choice of view at check in. The staff at the front desk was very nice. The room was very cozy offering a comfy matress with plenty of pillows. The hotel is only a mile or so away from international drive, and Universal is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cinipp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from Universal Studios. The staff are very nice and helpfull. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. They have a very nice flat screen tv but not too many channels. There is a free shuttle that takes you to Universal at two differnt times in the morning and picks you up later in the day. If you wanted to come back earlier you could walk or take a cab for $4.40 not including tip. They have a free breakfast of breads, oatmeal, cereal, fruit and coffee & tea & juices but if you want eggs or waffels you have to pay for them. There is not a restaurant on the premises but they do have a limited menu that you can order from. There is a Friday's restaruant down that street that you can walk to. We find that the Hyatt Place hotels are a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “BEST DEAL IN ORLANDO”
Reviews.Author: Geokkat
Reviews.Content: HUGE room for 3 teens & 2 adults (1 in a wheelchair) with room left over! Wonderful staff-manager used his own car to try & jumpstart our van's dead battery, then called his mechanic, then took my husband & dead battery to WalMart to buy a new one (above & beyond the call of duty). Just ask at the front desk for the BEST Mexican restaurant nearby. Great breakfast in beautiful hotel across the street from main entrance to Universal. Book through Universal Studios website for GREAT DEAL on hotel/tickets to parks.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Hotel Close”
Reviews.Author: njm0725
Reviews.Content: Our only problem was a broken lid on the toilet. We changed rooms. All hotels have some problems. The good about this hotel is, close to Universal, clean room and comfortable bed and the dispensers in the shower for bath gel, shampoo and conditioner were good. The bad part is the bathroom is too small. Large people would not be happy with the size. Breakfast in the morning is limited. Other hotels offer much more.

Reviews.Title: “our stay on ID”
Reviews.Author: petecrawley
Reviews.Content: We have just completed the first part of a three centre holiday,i can only praise this hotel for the efforts of the staff and the quality of the rooms,we found the location superb with bars and different places to eat all within a 5 min walk,from the local Dennys to the more up market resturants.international drive is full of places to stay but we liked the seperate seating area and the large tv, breakfast was included and we found that the chioce was more than enough,the children in hotel seemed to enjoy it too.with the reception area open 24hrs, coffee was always availiable.the refurbishment of the rooms was underway when stayed but the noise levels were not intrusive,and i must say the refurb is well worth it,i think Virgin holidays should re-think the removal of this small but well located hotel.the pool is small and the sun beds are limited but dont let this put you off we always found a sunny spot and the depth does not exceed 5.2ft so quite safe for everyone.parking is plentifull and the spaces are large all the doors in the hotel will easily acommodate a wheel chair and the shower only bathroom has 2 large sliding doors.we would deffinatley stay here again well done to every body involved in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great and modern, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: cvindel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a Disney Cruise. We wanted to take the kids to Universal Studios after the cruise and also wanted to stay close to Universal. The room was spacious and had modern ammenities (flat-screen tv with multiple video hookups if you're carrying your own equipment). The room was clean and the staff courteous and helpful. I definitely recommend it and would stay again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marie42472
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Friday evening to a bit of a problem. I had booked a room large enough for our family of five through AAA. Unfortunately, the hotel was told we needed a room for two people, had reserved us one King sized bed, and AAA hadn't even given us the AAA rate! However, Chris and Jesse fixed the problem, found us the last double with sleeper sofa room at the hotel, and gave us the cheaper AAA rate. The room was plenty large enough for our family of five, the breakfast was good, and the location can't be beat. You won't be sorry if you book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in walking distance of Universal”
Reviews.Author: ParryFamily
Reviews.Content: I wanted a reasonable hotel in walking distance of Universal and this was exactly it. We stayed for two nights at the end of our holiday so that we could visit Universal and my daughter could buy a wand. The hotel was situated in or around a five minute drive from Universal or a 10 minute walk. Hotel was in the process of being re-furbished so some rooms were off limits. The room allocated was a large room with two double beds and a small separate seating area with the customary fridge /kitchenette. Bathroom was an OK size although there was a dent in the wall which looked like someone had head butted it. The room had a large HD TV but the channel options according to my daughter were a bit limited, no Disney! The hotel had a small swimming pool to one end which in the end we didn't get time to use. The room rate included breakfast which was an odd version of the continental, mix of cereals , yoghurt, bagels, doughnuts and fresh fruit but was still appreciated. There appeared to be a number of restaurants near by but we chose to walk five minutes down the road to a TFI. Overall a good hotel, reasonable price and convenient for Universal.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY HEAVENLY"”
Reviews.Author: robert8185
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here this past weekend and we left with hardly no complaints! The hotel is located seriously across the street from Universal Studios. According to the staff, its about a 20 minute walk. Speaking about the staff, they were probably one of the nicest hotel staff I've ever encountered (even at 1am on a Thursday for our late check-in). The rooms are very roomy. They come with a nice desk that you can work from, a small refrigerator/sink area, a large sofa in the "living room" area that converts to a sofa bed. I loved the 42" TV!! The bed/bedding were HEAVENLY. We really could of slept all day on it. The bathroom although small wasn't so much of an inconvenience although a slightly larger one would be better of course. The sink is located outside from the bathroom but that wasn't an issue for us either. The only critic my gf had was that the room didn't posses enough cabinents to put our clothes away. Getting into the hotel by the side (non-main entrances) was a little difficult and took several unsuccessful room key swipes before we got the hang of it. We never had the free continental breakfast so I can't review that, however we did use the microwave in there (There wan't one in the room). We also didn't order any room service/Starbucks although both are available 24 hours and by the looks of it had a great selection. They also had a bar that served drinks until midnight. There is a TGI Fridays located on the grounds of the hotel next door (5 minute walk max) which is a good option for dine in or pick up. We went to the pool area just to smoke a cigarette and never got in although it looked very clean. A tad bit small but nothing out of the ordinary. All and all this is mainly a business oriented hotel but I didn't mind that one bit. Free (and quick) Wi-Fi as well as free wireless printing thru their print-me station (which came in handy to print out our Sea World Tickets). So if you plan on visiting Universal and are considering this hotel, do not hesitate. You will leave very happy, we sure did!

Reviews.Title: “a resort for your LAST resort”
Reviews.Author: poyastropearson
Reviews.Content: Might be good for the college crowd but not for the family orientated. Our air conditioner broke, but was fixed for us. Our shower leaked onto the floor. We had to stand next to the toilet in order to open/close the bathroom door. Fire alarm drill went off and we were never informed that we did not have to leave the room. When we confronted the staff at the front desk-they simply said "We're sorry" with a smirk on their face then they all laughed about it as we walked back to our room. Elevator wait was long. Only one of the two elevators were working. Towels in the room were rough, not soft at all. The best part of this hotel was its location to Universal Studios. We even checked out one day early and stayed at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: MarcneilDC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hyatt Place location many times for business over the last three years. It's my go to place in Orlando. I've also stayed for leisure with my family. Obviously I love this property. I have always found the staff to very friendly and super accommodating. The rooms are kept clean. The complimentary breakfast is a nice bonus. Should you have a problem or a concern, I suggest you ask for Yolaida, one of the hotel managers. She'll make it right. Chris, Farah and Yamiley at the front desk are also great, very friendly and always helpful. They treat me like royalty. I'm a Hyatt guy...love the brand...so I guess I'm a bit biased. I travel 45 weeks out the year. Have stayed at lots of different properties. The Hyatt Place is comfortable and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: r0ch3lle
Reviews.Content: my sister and i stayed in this hotel when we were in orlando. we were planning on going to the universal theme parks and the location of this hotel was convenient. it is across the street from the entrance of the universal resorts BUT i dont think that it is a walkable distance to the parks at all (unless you are very fond of walking when you know you are going to be on your feet all day in the parks). the hotel was very modern and clean. i liked the lobbly. there was free breakfast but the dining area was a little too small. pool was nice and clean and towels were provided. the room was great. two comfy beds, big screen tv, a sleeper sofa, work desk, fridge and free wifi. the bathroom was on the small side. we will stay here again if we're going to be in the orlando area. close drive to the disney parks, sea world resorts, outlets and airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, less than stellar staff”
Reviews.Author: dayafterxmas
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, Hyatt was a great choice for our short visit in July of 2010. We were only there for two nights, and the hotel provided us with a clean and comfortable place to rest up for our first experience of the Wizarding World of Harry Potter. When we first arrived, we found five different employees working the front desk, and all of them seemed a litlte lost. I had booked two double beds online and when we arrived, they had given us a room with one king bed. God forbid I want what I paid and specifically asked for! The staff was friendly about the mix-up but it ended up taking them 45 minutes to fix the problem while we were shuffled from one employee to the next, all of them unable to correct the problem. In fact, a staff member would start to help us, then disappear and never return! It was such an odd thing to see. We'd then move to a different employee, who would do the same thing! We finally found somebody who fixed the problem without an issue, but the fact that it took us over 45 minutes to fix what was clearly a non-issue was pretty ridiculous. Still, it didn't ruin the place for us, as the rooms were well-worth the shuffle. I found other places that were cheaper to stay in Orlando with better staff, but Hyatt was good for what we needed it for in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT and think it is a great Universal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UPINWI
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be large with updated furniture and tv. The sofa bed wasn't as comfy as others I have slept on, but it wasn't bad either. Locations is great of you are spending time at Unversal. My only complaints are that the elevators seemed slow, bathroom a tad small, and there isn't ice on every floor. The staff however is great. They were so engaging. All the hotel staff seemed nice and really seemed to like being there.

Reviews.Title: “lots of space!”
Reviews.Author: lorihas2
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 2 adults and 4 teens. The hotel rooms are very large, clean, looked to be new furniture, they had a big plasma tv and best of all the rooms connected! The hotel offers a free breakfast that was really good. The staff was very friendly and the complementary shuttle to Universal was a plus! A great valve too

Reviews.Title: “Great lttle hotel, convenient to Universal and WetNWild”
Reviews.Author: traveler2265
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 4 kids and myself (11,13,16,18). The kids report the pool as okay - fine to cool off after all the walking at Universal. The front desk staff was fabulous - quick to take care of requests and always with a smile, very guest conscientious. The housekeeping staff was terrific also - extra towels were never a problem. Right across from Universal and around the corner to WetNWild. Plenty of restaurants close by. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No water at Hyatt Place Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: unhappytravel06
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a Hyatt in the middle of June 2011. There is literally nothing in the walking distance except for the Universal Studios and TGI Fridays . Make a reservation before you go to TGI Fridays. Since it appears to be the only restaurant in the walking distance from other hotels too, there is a line of people even after 9 pm.on Monday night. The hotel shut down water from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. during two days of our stay without apologies, discounts/refunds and â€œwater shut downâ€� project completion dateâ€¦ When you need to take a cab to go anywhere, call the yellow cab yourself â€“ do not rely on the hotel. It appears that hotel supports some â€œundergroundâ€� taxi service which charges twice as much as the yellow cab. Cons: - The room smelled like mildew - Bathroom size is beyond small - there is not enough room to close the bathroom door from the bathroom, you have to stand in the tub in order to close the door Pros: - Excellent air conditioner unit - very quiet - The hotel offers decent toiletries â€“ nice ginger smell - Free breakfast includes fresh cut fruit - There is free internet access If you have to choose between staying at Hyatt or Rosen, chose Hyatt, or, better yet, stay at home.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: trexhere
Reviews.Content: For our theme park honeymoon (Busch Gardens, Universal, Disney World) we stayed at the Hyatt place for 5 nights in the middle of May. Upon check in they did not have a room available and were unable to meet our request for a high floor room (made 3 months on advance upon booking the room). They did point us to some nice local restaurants while they found us a room. The room was nice and affordable for the rate we received considering it had a fridge, couch, TV and king bed. The shuttle to Universal arrived on time daily and the drivers were very nice and would enter the lobby area before leaving to see if anyone had not made it outside before they departed. However the shuttles (obviously an outside company) were dirty, falling apart, and no AC! Getting back to the Hyatt was another story.. The shuttle arrived at Universal (sometimes late) and passengers had seconds to board before the shuttle departs. We missed the shuttle on the second night as my wife and I were heading to the shuttle and it departed as soon as it had arrived! I don't blame the drivers as the next day we asked the morning driver and they have multiple stops at different hotels and a time schedule to keep, but why canâ€™t Hyatt afford its own shuttle bus? Some other issues: Our toilet stopped flushing the 3rd night and the maintenance man(?) advised us to quickly turn off the water supply and turned it back on when needing to flush itâ€¦ They were unable to fix it until the morning.... The breakfast was lame and even though it wasnâ€™t that busy when we went, my wife, 15 people and myself in the small lobby/breakfast area made it seem very crowded. Final issue is security! Morning/noon/evening/ middle of the night flyers for pizza places were being pushed under our door. On night I put out the do not disturbed sign and in the morning it was gone. Someone put the sign on our door after we left for Universal and therefore our room did not get cleaned! Sometimes my key card to enter the building and other times it didnâ€™tâ€¦ When it comes down to it, it was our honeymoon so I didnâ€™t let a lot of this stuff bother me at the time and it didnâ€™t ruin our honeymoon, it just ruined our impression of Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Floridian32084
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a Hyatt Place before, (in Oklahoma City) and we enjoyed our stay in Orlando as well. It is directly across the street from Universal Studios and has a shuttle service to Universal and Disney, but it only runs twice in the morning and twice in the afternoon. Breakfast is good, but if you don't get downstairs by 9:30 you won't get any. Also, if you have children on the sofa bed, be sure to ask for a blanket. Ours did not have one in the closet. Hairdryers are weak. Rooms are clean and comfortable and staff is helpful and friendly. Price was good and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mcos
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days in June. Stay was for business but the location would be perfect for a vacation at Universal. Wish the pool was a bit more involved. Good stop.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place.”
Reviews.Author: Jockystraxs
Reviews.Content: Really close to Universal Studios, just a 15min walk. We used the free shuttle bus,courtesy of Hyatt. Taxi is only $5-6 and quick. Breakfast had a good assortment of things to eat. Hot breakfast can be ordered but you have to pay. Staff really good and any request was handled quickly. Rooms were spacious considering the price we paid. Would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel with great staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Toto44
Reviews.Content: I expected a little more from a Hyatt, for the price and from the pictures on the website. Having booked directly via the Hyatt website, the pictures online showed an elegant room with a comfortable living room area and kitchen facilities. The reality was a little different. The room was dark and poorly lit. Beds were small & uncomfortable. Bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever been in, more like a broom closet. After the initial shock on entering the room, feeling disappointed that I had booked this hotel for a once in a lifetime holiday and looking out the window wishing I had booked the holiday inn suites directly opposite, I started to realise I was here for a week, time to get on with it. The complimentary toiletries were nice and of good quality. The complimentary wifi was also a nice touch and was very fast speed. The complimentary continental breakfast was nice for the first day or two but got very repetitive and boring after a few days. It would have been nice to see a few changes every few days (maybe some croissants, cheese, pain au choc, cookies ?). Although I have to say there was always plenty there. The staff were very friendly from checkin to checkout and nothing was ever too much trouble for them. They really did make the hotel a brighter place. The pool area was very disappointing, not luxury at all, very basic. As was the 'fitness suite'. The location is fantastic. Right opposite universal studios and a 15 min drive from disney. Sea World / Wet n Wild less than 5-10 min drive. Overall I would stay here if I was in Orlando for a night or two for a business trip but would not choose to stay here if I was on that once in a lifetime family holiday or looking for some luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MLQuock
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights to visit Universal - wish I had sprung for one of the on-site hotels. LOCATION - Mileage-wise, Hyatt is close - as they say "across the street". But the street is almost the width of a highway and is not really pedestrian friendly. And when it is 90 degrees out, you really don't feel like walking. The free shuttle only runs twice in the morning and twice in the evening, and the times don't coincide with the park hours. so if you want to get there before the park opens (to beat the lines at Harry Potter), or stay there past 7pm, you have to walk in the hot weather or take a cab. And you have to wait 10 min from the time the front desk calls the cab to come. and when none of taxi drivers even know WHERE the Hyatt Place is, you know you've picked the wrong hotel. BREAKFAST - nice that they provide free continental breakfast but not the place to be if you want a hot breakfast. There is a TGIFridays next door but breakfast buffet there is horrible CLEANLINESS - agree with other reviewers that that carpet was gross and the couch felt grimy. the room had a musty smell and humid feel. the A/C was the old fashioned wall unit, and terribly noisy if you are trying to sleep. the towels could use an extra wash and bleach as well. CONVENIENCE - be warned there is NO atm machine...I had to run next door to the Holiday Inn. check in and check out is quick since they have automated machines (like airport check in). they have a desk that sells park tickets but the woman in front of me was taking too long. there is no information book in the room so i had to call the front desk every time i had a question. the one great thing was the free wi-fi in the room. The elevators were so slow. AMENITIES - The fitness center should be re-labeled as two treadmills in a closet. They have a printer so you can print boarding passes. There is a pool but I did not use it. All in all, stay here only if you rent a car and only need a cheap place to sleep for one night. They spent all of their money on the TV and forgot about upgrading everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and value for money”
Reviews.Author: cococorrin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quaint, at a good location, homely and comfortable. Room was big and spacious, enough to fit 3 comfortably. Staff was friendly but didnt go the extra mile for service. Room was also clean although the toilet was a bit too small. Very informal hotel and good enough for a night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicola_James
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about the location of this hotel because of the varying times people had quoted regarding the distance to Universal Studios. It takes 10 minutes. The shuttle also takes 10 minutes because of traffic and parking. The walk is very pleasant and enjoyable and you are free to go and return whenever you like - would definitely recommend walking. The rooms were a very good size. The bathroom was a little on the small size but perfectly reasonable. On our arrival at check in the staff member was not helpful, he couldn't find our reservation and was quite rude about it. Another member of staff took over and found it immediately. For the rest of our stay all staff were exceptionally nice. There is a refrigerator in the room which was great. The pool was quite small but was always empty so it was lovely to relax. The is no pool bar but nobody had a problem with us taking our own drinks down to the pool (which saved us a lot of money). There is a TGI Friday's next door and a place called Miller's ale house a 5 minute walk away which is amazing - excellent food and drink deals! There is also a Cracker Barrel restaurant 2 minutes away which served nice food but did not serve alcohol. The only slight disappointment was that there is no safe in the room. The reception staff will provide you with a free safety deposit box in the office which you can access at any time but it was just not as convenient as having it in your room. The air conditioning in our room seemed quite noisy in comparison with other hotels which sometimes kept us awake but it was certainly better than having a very hot room.There was complimentary breakfast which we didn't take full advantage of, but it was fabulous to have a free coffee every morning! There is an I-ride stop close by which is great, however it was only for the green line which will take you to wet n wild and sea world but does not go down International drive so you have to change lines which can be inconvenient. If anyone is planning to go to Disney the hotel offers a shuttle for $14 pp round trip but you can actually get a bus for $4 pp round trip (Get the I-ride to G13 and there is a 'Lynx' bus which takes you directly to Disney). Overall we had an excellent holiday and as my only slight disappointment was that there was no safe in the room I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone doing a universal holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: wagtail685
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks during our family vacation to the Disney and Universal parks. The hotel is in a great spot to walk (15 mins) to Universal and in a quiet area albeit near to a major junction. The iTrolley stop is 2 minutes walk which was a bonus and it has a Cracker Barrel next door with a 7-11 across the road which was very convenient. The hotel staff were always helpful and courteous, the room was a good size (twin double beds with a pull out sofa bed) and everything worked. Air con, water, TV (huge) etc etc. The TV was great as it has connections for all popular portable devices so if you have an iPad with a tv conenction cable, bring it loaded with kids programmes and films and they'll love you for it! There's a gym room with a few bits of kit, but not a fully kitted out gym by any sretch of the imagination, a pool outside which I have to say was a bit cold. Even in 35c outside temp I was shivering in the water, so maybe look into that Hyatt? But the kids loved it. We spent most of the time out at the parks or eating in the multitude of bars and grill available locally. TGIs next door is also a bonus, but..... This hotel is not prepared for its own popularity. Both in terms of the amount of people staying and needing food in the morning and its catering for international guests. Breakfast is served in the reception area and consists of bagels, English muffins (word to the wise Hyatt, please just call them muffins because they certainly aren't english) fresh fruit, biscuits and gravy (for us english guests, scones and a flour based chopped sausage sauce) and cereals. You can order hot food from the terminal but at extra cost. You do get fed up to the back teeth with a carb loaded breakfast each day but the real issue is the fact there is nowhere to sit. I would estimate there is space for 20 or so people at the tables in reception. We ended up eating in the conference room across the hall which really isn't ideal, then towards the end of our holiday started collecting our food and taking it back to our rooms. We were forced on two occasions to eat in the hotel in the evening (young kids and a late return from a park) and if you thought American portions were large then this will certainly dispel that myth. I would describe them as kids portions and that still might leave my 7 year old hungry to be honest. I appreciate this isn't a restaurant and not set up to produce large quantities but for the price we expect a bit more. Despite this it was still a trouble free stay but I would stay again for more than a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: coloradoga
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice if you are going to the Universal Studios Park. The hotel is new and well maintained. The rooms are not very big, but comfortable. Everything is clean and tidy. The breakfast is good, the only thing I didn't like very much is that the tables are in the reception area, so, sometimes there aren't enough seats available.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel located within walking distance to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Dav_1010
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on its location. You can walk to Universal in about 15-20 minutes from the hotel. We found our room to be very noisy with lots of noise in the hallways coming into the room. The room was a bit dated and was gloomy and not well illuminated. The free breakfast was pretty poor compared to what you get in a Hampton Inn. My biggest gripe was the noise and I probably would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “STOLEN WEDDING RING”
Reviews.Author: Andiamo_All
Reviews.Content: Was in town to run the Disney 1/2 Marathon in early Jan, 2011 and my wedding ring was stolen from this hotel while I was out visiting a Disney property after the run. My husband and I immediately filed a police report and talked to the hotel management. Unbelievably, the hotel manager told us that "there has never been an issue" at this property before, which was a direct contradiction to what a detective told us upon filing the report. The person that last entered our room was an employee that had been with the hotel for only three weeks, and they were not questioned, reprimanded, and my ring is still missing. Nice customer service, isn't it? Other than the loss of the most sentimental piece of jewelry I've ever owned along with the frustration of calling pawn shops night and day for the following weeks (and still not finding it), the hotel itself was fine. The service and help is not to be trusted at this hotel - please make note.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one or two-night stay; wouldn't make this a home base for a longer trip”
Reviews.Author: kala327
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one-night only and it was fine for what I needed. i was coordinating a stay with relatives staying at a property two buildings down, but I had points to redeem with Hyatt so I stayed here as opposed to paying $150++ at the other property. Some thoughts on this hotel: I am a Gold Passport member that redeemed points for this stay and the hotel did not honor my request (as stated in the original reservation, i.e., not a last-minute request) for a higher floor room so that was a bit disconcerting, but no big deal. It is a small property with 3-4 floors so I can't comment on the elevator speed that others have complained about as I did not use them (yes, they put me in a first floor room by the pool, but luckily I checked in late and the pool was closing around then so there wasn't much noise to contend with.) I liked the self-serve snack bar and the 24-hour Starbucks and actually took advantage of it for a late-night snack. Prices were reasonable and it was nice to be able to grab something without having to get in the car and find a convenience store or paying through the nose for room service. Breakfast was fine but awkward. There were juices, fruit, "fake" bagels, English muffins, packaged cereals and made-to-order options (the latter at a surcharge). The bagels seemed to be mass-produced, thawed frozen ones, but they were passable for a "free" breakfast. The flow in the breakfast room is poor as it is a small room so there was a lot of bumping into people who were backtracking to grab other items. In fact, there is no flow at all. I am guessing that the property this was before it became a Hyatt did not have a breakfast area so Hyatt did the best they could with the space that was there but it definitely is awkward and incredibly small. Also, I found it a bit odd that they put wet -- albeit clean -- glasses top down on a wood shelf without any placemat or the like underneath. Who knows how clean the wood shelf is and I thought this was a little strange. Take note if you are a germaphobe. As to the hotel room itself, it more or less is what you see in the website photo although it is not very large. As long as it is clean, I am happy though and I found no issues with the bed linens although one of the bath towels had a dark stain which I didn't notice until after I used it (gross). Hopefully it was clean. I stayed at another property nearby a year or so earlier and the floor and in-room sofa was so sticky I couldn't/wouldn't take my shoes off while walking around the room, so the Hyatt was a marked improvement. There was an in-room safe although I didn't use it. There was a firdge (no freezer shelf though) which was nice although it was in the "off" position when I got there so I had to wait a bit for it to cool down the water I was planning to store there overnight. The hotel was booked that night and I feared a first-floor room would be noisy with the pool nearby and being near the lobby but the extra loud A/C unit helped to deflect any noise... I imagine it is a vestige of whatever the property was prior to being a Hyatt but it was loud and not thermostat controlled. One of those, hi/lo fan hot/cold numbers. Not a deal breaker, but unless you like that kind of constant loud din to block out other noise and lull you to sleep, that was the biggest detratcion from an otherwise nice room. Service was great, very friendly and outgoing. They also gave a 15% card for restaurants at CityWalk upon check in -- which I did not use, but is worth mentioning to other travelers. I don't know what they charge for rooms as I did not pay, but if it is over $100, then I would suggest shopping around becuase it is not a full-service hotel and there are a ton of other options in the immediate area. Also, this as is not a full-service, resort hotel I wouldn't stay here for long trips as it is not that comfortable a property. Even if you just use it as a place to sleep, your average traveller would like to have some additional creature comforts, which this hotel does not have. So, for one or two nights with non-fussy travelers, I say this place is worth consideration. To put this hotel in perspective, even the person at reception when I checked in "warred" me that this is the "basic level" of Hyatt so I shouldn't expect anything similar to what you get at a Hyatt Regency. Well put; I couldn't say it better myself.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful! You may fall victim to a police shake down!”
Reviews.Author: Nyctravelers317
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and nice, so no problems there. It's also really close to the park and they offer free daily shuttles to universal. The reason I am giving this hotel terrible reviews is because of an incident that occured two nights ago. We were in town to celebrate my fiance's birthday, when on the evening of birthday he was stopped by two police officers in the elevator and escorted out of the hotel. Once outside he was made to kneel/sit on the curb while the police officers interrogated him. People stopped to stare. You see, the hotel seems to have a problem with local restaurants sending out their employees to slide fliers beneath the doors of hotel patrons. This of course is trespassing, so the hotel wants it to stop. When the hotel staff catches wind of this they simply call the police. On march 12th someone on staff reported that my fiancÃ© fit the description of one of these restaurant employees so he was apprehended and made to kneel on the ground like a common criminal in front of the hotel doors. While I understand the hotels position, it doesn't take a genius to figure out that there is too much traffic in this hotel for someone to really be apprehended based on "fitting the description." these criminals will need to be caught red handed or via video surveillance, not. Otherwise there will be more instances of mistaken identity, and frankly it's unacceptable to have hotel patrons abused in this manner. The issue with the trespassers is the hotels problem, not the patrons. The hotel did comp us 75% for the night this happened, but it doesn't take away the sting of being treated like a common criminal. The cops even refused to allow my fiancÃ© to show them his hotel room key. After about 30 or so minutes of being held on the curb the cops let him go after someone on staff cleared his ID. Meanwhile no one called to apologize. The next day I spoke to the manager on duty and she assured me that someone named Yolanda would call me the next morning at 6am. She also said Yolanda tried to call our room but we weren't present. Why she didn't call the cell phone number on file is beyond me. Also, the next morning the only call I recieved was from a hotel clerk telling us a cab was waiting to take us to the airport. How the Sunday manager confused needing to speak with yolanda at 6am with get us a taxi at 6am is beyond me. We left for the airport at 6:30 and Yolanda had not arrived for her shift. All in all were were traumatized by the experience and won't ever visit this hotel again if they continue to combat their issue with trespassers at the expense of their guests. Had my fiancÃ© not been so outwardly calm, he could have been arrested. The cops need only to perceive some degree of hostility from a "perp" to haul him off to jail

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Good Location - Small Bathroom and Weird Closet”
Reviews.Author: aml3679
Reviews.Content: Originally we were going to stay at Lowe's Royal Pacific Hotel. When we looked at the $300 a night plus tax, parking, etc. we decided to stay off site. I chose this hotel because of the reviews and more importantly the location. PROS: Customer Service - very friendly and they go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Free breakfast which we had twice - coffee, juice, cereal, etc. Cracker Barrell Restaurant in their parking lot which has a great breakfast we went to twice. Very spacious. CONS: Not the hotel's fault, but the advertisement that you can walk to Univeral Studios in not correct. We did not use the shuttle so we cannot comment. No safe. The bathroom is very small. The closet is also weird - half of it is blocked by the sink. Three small drawers for clothing. Small night tables. Slowest elevators ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Serevice”
Reviews.Author: GJY
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable, spacious and very well laid out. The sink at the wet bar made it convenient for two people to get ready at the same time. But above all, it was the friendliness & quality of the service. From quickly handling a correction to the reservation at check in, the warm, fresh from the oven cookies for the kids, to hand delivering the Kindle I left at the bar, they consistently exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “No Compassion”
Reviews.Author: Sheepdogwalker
Reviews.Content: We ran into trouble on the last days of our week stay at Hyatt Place Universal. My wife required unanticipated emergency surgery so I asked to extend our stay. The desk attendant said that was possible BUT AT AN INCREASED RATE. Talk about profiting from others' misfortune! I am writing this from the hospital where my wife has just emerged from surgery. I was able to find a much nicer and less expensive lodging for the time of her recovery in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sldingman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my four young adult children. We all stayed in one room and the room size was great. The hotel was very clean, the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good, just make sure you are there on time. We got there a few mins late and everything was put away. However, if you asked, they were very nice about getting us food. The walk to Universal was about 15 mins. If you have small children, the walk would be long, but we had no problem. There are a few restaurants within walking distance. This hotel is very convenient and exceptionally well run. I would go back there in a heartbeat. We had an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff minor problems with website”
Reviews.Author: GotDrums
Reviews.Content: I am a Hyatt Gold Passport member and love Hyatt Places for the consistency of what you get from your stay at a Hyatt Place. To date I have not seen a bad one. Plus you have to love the fact that as a Gold member you are allowed late check out at 2 which is really great if you are possibly checking in to a different hotel that day. That being said. At check in they wanted to charge me almost $90.00 more than when I booked the trip online on your website. Lucky I had a copy of the confirmation as well as the accurate total of $306.00 not $390.00 that they attempted to charge me. They did honor my original confirmation of 306.00. Plus I did not like the fact that I was forced to use a credit card to put down $40.00 for incidentals which I did not want as well. Whether you use 40 in cash or 40 on a debit card is a mote point. The big problem is that you have to wait to get your 40 back if you use a debit/credit card. With cash you get it back right away. I have never had to use a card at any other Hyatt Place. Did not like that I was forced to use on here even after appealing to the manager. Bad customer service and a bad choice on part of the manager.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but has Issues”
Reviews.Author: Trailblazer44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights here in January/11 and enjoyed the location of the property mostly..We walked to the Premium Outlet Mall on International Drive one day which is about 3 miles each way thru the Universal Park area via Universal Blvd. I read many peoples posts on here saying its a long walk to Universal Studios entrance!! Trust me, its such a easy nice walk, I could have done it blindfolded!!To spend $15 dollars for parking to drive there is crazy if you have legs use them..It took us exactly 14 minutes to arrive at Universal City Walk area via Major Blvd and then left up Universal Blvd to the entrance along a beautiful pathway.(The sidewalk is located on the right side of Major Blvd only) The Hyatt Place is kinda nice, and kinda not nice in other respects.The staff are the best part of the hotels experience.Our room which was the one I requested, end unit high floor was located next to the stairwell (and noisy ice machine) and I am really happy it was because like others on here posted,the elevators are awful they were not replaced or updated when Hyatt bought this building.They have the appearance inside of being old and neglected just worn out. We used that aforementioned stairwell next to our room for coming and going and it was clean and bright and much better than using the brutally slow elevators. Our room had a kinda gritty feel to the couch like it wasn't vacuumed good (or at all) and the bathroom is so small you have to go outside of it if you want to change your mind.That dosen't bother us much because you are only in there to (well you know) but it was also not really clean with dirt in the corners and a few floor tiles were broken and one even lifted if you stepped on the corner of it. It was warm 73f and the AC kept it nice but I suspect when its 90f in the summer the room may be hot because it dosen't have much gumption and seems weak. We used the pool after our long walk and it is salt water but again the area around there is not really clean.The loungers are dirty and the bottom of the pool looks like it needs scrubbing..The water looked good and we enjoyed its size and 6 ft depth all to ourselves. The Cracker Barrel next door is fantastic and we ate there a couple of times and coming back used our room key to gain entrance at a door (to the pool) that had the stairwell that took us straight to the room. Overall for the price I paid $61.00 a night it was good, but I would have been disappointed if I had paid $125.00..I think it is worth below the $100.00 a night mark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: lettergirl40
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this Hyatt before leaving for a cruise. The room was nice a roomy but it had a very musty smell. Overall, the room was clean and in a good location. There is a TGI Fridays and Cracker Barrel within walking distance. It is across the interstate from Universal Studios. They did say they had a heated pool which they needed when we were there because it was cold for Florida.....The breakfast was good and they offered a nice variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Universal, average-to-disappointing in other respects”
Reviews.Author: MaineScott
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2011 and chose the hotel based on a previous experience with the chain and the location, as I wanted to visit the Universal theme parks while I was in town. On the location front, I was not disappointed. You literally leave the hotel, take a left, go across the street, and you're in Universal. You could walk it if you felt like it, though I drove. There are a couple of hotels clustered right around this area, so I can't say that it's impossible to find a better location, but if you plan to spend time at Universal this hotel is really convenient. Other than the location, I found the hotel disappointing. In part this may have been because I have had much better experiences with this chain in the past. I'm not sure when this hotel was built, but the maintenance of it is lacking. The reception area is well kept, but other public areas like the elevators were so beaten up they reminded me of the dumpy apartment buildings I used to live in during college. The rooms were also a little disappointing. I'm actually not sure that the photos they show on the website are actually of this property. The photos show a room divided by an artsy, shade-style wall, but that is not what the rooms at this property are actually like. (Though other Hyatt Place properties I've stayed at do have that sort of decor, which is why I think the website just shows generic, stock photos.) The room cleanliness was also a little disappointing, as my dresser drawer contained a couple of empty beer bottles and caps. On the plus side, the room is relatively spacious thanks to the separate sitting area (though the bathrooms are as small as they can possibly be), and the television is huge. The other amenities are kind of a mixed bag. The "fitness center" was disappointing. A more apt name for it would be "a couple of treadmills arranged in a closet". The business center had a printer, which was useful for printing my boarding pass. The breakfast offerings were forgettable enough that I opted to eat at the airport on my last day. I did not get to try out the pool, but it looked fine. The staff were friendly and helpful. The wi-fi was free and reliable, though too slow to do something like stream a TV show online. Overall I was a little disappointed with my experience at this hotel. If I return to the area I will likely stay at a different property.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel with horrible bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: raeabear
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into this hotel after checking out early at another hotel where we had an unpleasent experience. While the hotel and staff were great, my major complaint was the bathroom in our room. You literally could not flush any toilet paper bigger than a one square one ply piece of toilet paper down, then you had to flush at least 3 times before anything would happen. Anything bigger than the one square would cause the toilet to become backed up. We notified the front desk, but I don't think they actually came up to fix it seeing how it continued to not flush and get backed up. The only other complaint was the beds, since we checked in so late we ended up with a standard 2 double bed room, but the pillowtop mattresses were so uncomfortable that my husband ended up having to sleep in one bed and me in the other--not that big of a deal, except it was our honeymoon and it would've been nice to share a bed. Neither of us got a good night's sleep because of the beds. Other minor inconveniences: the elevator took forever to work, the inputs on the tv where you can hook up your laptop wouldn't work (not a huge deal since we were there for only 1 night and had spent the majority of the day enjoying Universal), they had the other eatting area closed off so it was every man for himself when trying to find a place to sit, and apparently the lady before my husband took all of the toast (some 4 or 5 pieces) right when he was going to grab a slice (not the hotel's fault, just a rude lady). The hotel is in a great location and easily accessable to Universal. You can easily walk there in approx 15-20 minutes, but they do offer a free shuttle to Universal, as well as a shuttle to Disney (cost $14/person)--not worth it when you can pay just $15 to park. They also, upon check in give you a little card that gives you access to discounts (15% off at some of the restaurants and shops on Universal). If it wasn't for the toilet and the beds (which are apparently standard at all Hyatts, so if you have a bad back, stay away from Hyatt), our stay would've been worth it. Instead, we left feeling like we would've gotten a better night's sleep at the cheaper hotel we had to leave b/c of noise levels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Universal”
Reviews.Author: onekbear
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right across the street from Universal -- great location if that's where you are headed. Pool is mid-sized, but nice and clean. Service at the hotel was terrific -- whatever you want -- the really make an effort. They serve an adequate breakfast in the lobby. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and pretty good sized. This is NOT a luxury hotel, but for the price, it offers a very good product. By the way, we got our room for around $50 including all taxes, on priceline. For that price, it was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel clean rooms nicest staff and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Traveller11970
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel nothing bad to say if you r planning for universal stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Universal Studios Parks!”
Reviews.Author: ManateeLuv
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 adults stayed here on Christmas day and the day after. We had two rooms on the 5th floor that were very clean and comfortable. We stayed in suites that had separate lounging areas. It had a very roomy sectional couch with leather ottoman. The flat screen TVs were fab and could be viewed from both areas of the room. The hotel staff were very gracious. The mattresses were awesome and the bedding was soft and fresh smelling. There was a 24 hour room service and a variety of baked goods, sandwiches, and Starbucks coffee offered at the front desk. Drawbacks included: cramped bathroom, and a continental breakfast with no eggs or breakfast meats. Drawbacks were minor. Overall, the hotel stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Fairgrove4
Reviews.Content: We book a room at the last minute to visit with family members who were in the area. It was the Sunday after Thanksgiving and it was very quiet there. The hotel was very nice in giving us a room on the same floor as our relatives. The rooms were beautiful with large flat screen TV, pull out sleeper sofa, mini refrigerator and two double beds.They had an outdoor pool and an exercise area but I did not have a chance to check it out. They offer a small continental breakfast with basic cereal, donuts, bagels, apple, orange, coffee and juice. Hyatt is in walking distance to Universal, especially the Universal Hotel. Unfortunately you do have to cross a very busy street. The hotel does offer a shuttle free 2x in the morning and there after a charge of $2.00 per person. This is an updated hotel and the staff were polite and friendly. MY only problem I had encounter was an asthma attack I got in the room when a family member put on the heat and the feathered pillows. I was not able to sleep the rest of the night and found myself in the lobby for many hours. I had ask the staff for any benadryl but they didn't have any even to purchase. It did make for a long night. I would strongly advise any hotel to have a stock in Allergy Med.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: K617L
Reviews.Content: Great location with Shuttle to Universal. Small pool area. Very friendly staff, lot of smiling faces everywhere. Breakfast was so-so, but included. Mainly cereal, bagels, biscuits and gravy. Also fruit and yoghurt. Rooms were large with a pull-ou sofa. Small bathroom and there is a fridge. We love the giant flat screen televsion. Hyatt Place get kudos from me for allowing such easy access to the plugs which allow you to hook up your own devices (laptop, iPold, DVD) to the televsion and watch your own progamming with your extension cord. So many hotels block the plugs or block the auxiliary channel. I really appreciated this feature! Beds were a bit hard for me.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't do enough!!”
Reviews.Author: walkformilers
Reviews.Content: We arrived well before check in time due to an early flight from New Orleans. Debbie on reception went out of her way to try and get us checked in with the room requests we had made as quickly as possible. This level of service wasn't a one off. Throughout the next 10 days all the staff we talked to were helpful and pleasant, trying to do as much as they could to make your stay as good as possible. Room was always cleaned, and is what you need for a busy Orlando holiday. We went primarily for Halloween Horror nights and the location was FANTASTIC. 15 mins to Universal and a green line trolly stop a couple of minutes from the hotel. We normally stay on International Drive but found that Kirham road had some good resturants that didn't sell the same old stuff that you find in the normal tourist haunts. Try Azul mexican, babalious BBQ and the italian, (just down from hooters). Would definitely return to this area over International Drive next time, and would also make a bee-line for the Hyatt Place

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Ybowtie8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights in early September and couldn't have been happier. We arrived around 9:30 AM and did not expect to check in but wanted to park our car all day and walk to Universal Studios. They said no problem and offered us the use of the free shuttle that was coming at 9:45. When we returned that night (on the shuttle) our keys were all ready for us. The distance is a little more than walking distance but the shuttle was reliable and on time and convenient. Our room was large, clean and comfortable with a nice view of the park to the west. The bathroom is indeed small, especially trying to close the door. Water pressure was good and hot, cable and internet both worked fine. I had a meal one afternoon at the "bar" and it was good and reasonably priced. Breakfast was good. Service was outstanding all around. We bought our park tickets at the concierge and she was very helpful. The pool is a little small and not very private but it was clean, warm and well attended. We enjoyed it thoroughly. The parking lot is well lit and appeared secure. You needed a room key to enter the building through any of the side doors. One night we had very heavy rain and the access road to the hotel flooded due to a clogged drain and we didn't think we could get out. We had to cut through some parking lots to get to the main road but a lot of cars were stuck in the high water. Our only complaint was that the AC unit in our room made a lot of noise when it started up and woke us. We mentioned it at check-out and they said they would take care of it and we should have told them sooner. Everything else about our stay was so nice, we saw this as a minor problem.

Reviews.Title: “It gets better......”
Reviews.Author: Kruger_Fred
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel once already for our stay last year and I am happy to say standards have not dipped in any way, in fact I think they have improved on perfection. We stayed for 5 nights last year using Priceline and we were so happy that we booked 8 nights direct with the hotel this time and believe it or not a member of staff even remembered us! Anyway this will be short, we arrived to the Hyatt at 7am and check-in was at 3pm yet the very kind lady at the desk let us check-in 8 hours early so we could dump our bags in the room and enjoy a day at Islands of Adventure. What service. I guarantee not many places in England would offer this. The whole stay was comfortable, very close to Universal, rates are very good and so was breakfast for free. If you ever need a cab, get them to call for you as they use a very nice company who are competitive with pricing and when we left our bag of sandwiches for the day in the car, the driver took them back to the hotel for us and the staff at the Hyatt refrigerated them. Absolutely brilliant. Anyway, stay here when you are in Orlando, there's nowhere I'd rather stay more....

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Universal is clean and conveniently located.”
Reviews.Author: planningobsessor
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on Priceline for this hotel. The shuttle to Universal is very limited. There was adequate free parking at the hotel. The pool was small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and visit Universal!!”
Reviews.Author: amyleigh68
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I picked this hotel when visiting Universal with my two kids, 11 and 14. The hotel was very clean. The breakfast was great (and free)!! The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating! We were close enough to walk to Universal. We usually took a cab back at night because we were too tired to walk anymore, but that only cost about $4-5. The room was huge and beautiful. I can't say enough about this hotel. When I go to Universal again I will stay here. The price was very affordable too.

Reviews.Title: “Would return for sure”
Reviews.Author: GigiSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hyatt for a week while visiting Universal Studios with husband and two teenage sons. The room was awesome. With two queens and a sofa sleeper, boys had plenty of room...no fighting about which side of bed one or the other wanted! There was also a wet bar to be used for a second area to brush teeth. People compained about size of bathroom, which was small, fortunately because we are all thin it was not an issue. I can see where larger/average people would have an issue, we barely had room to open and close door. You had to stand on the opposite side of toilet to do so.
