There were so many other things I liked about the room (closet, large vanity area, large tv, desk for our laptop, mini fridge) that I can overlook the bathroom. Hotel staff was very nice and free breakfast was very helpful. We stopped at a Publix and bought breakfast sandwiches to heat up as well (since there was no egg/meat selections included in the complimentary breakfast. And yes, we walked to Universal Studios. It was a hike but the scenery is beautiful and I actually enjoyed it! One day we took the free shuttle, it drops off so far from park entrance..don't know if it was very much shorter of a walk. Same with the one day we paid $6 to take a taxi. When you walked you could take the valet entrance which was closer to park entrance than taxi or shuttle drop off. BTW it is only $3 to park after 6pm, however you still have the long walk to the park entrance...seriously, the best method for us was to walk to the park from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location, value - with a very Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: NYSAILORGAL
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with Hyatt's updte room, big tv, (if you have kids they have all the connection outlets for those video games) large room, king bed, mini kitchenette, big comfortable sofa with plenty of space for stretchng out. Solid breakfast options both complimentary or for fee (if you want something more elaborate); free breakfast was very good. They have a kitchen with grill and various light food items (nachos, burger, salads, appetizers, etc.), Starbucks coffee, wines and beer. This isn't a big bar, but they have a good selection for the end of the day. I had chicken quesadilla. It was listed as appetizer so I was expecting a mini quesadilla - got a meal sized portion with lots of chicken, cheese and veggies -- Impressive for that little kitchen. I was greeted by Kendall, who took time to show me around, give me some good suggestios about tickets and dining out. Really super personal service touches made this good hotel experience GREAT !! They have a shuttle to the various parks UNIV Stuidos is free, others have a small fee, but very low compared to rental cars fees, parking fees or taxi fees. You can walk to Universal, but during hot summer months it might be a bit much. Late Sep it was much cooler and an enjoyable morning walk. Other dining really close (FRIDAYS and Cracker Barrel); walking distance. ther are plenty of other restaurants within 4 miles or less. A Walmart is about 4 miles away if you want other options. 24 hr fitness center with water, towels and headsets !!! Small business ctr; but good for printing boarding passes, checking email, etc. Pool with good hrs; 24hr coffee shop; free parking (most hotels in area charge). Free wireless internet and very good connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Not as close to Universal as expected”
Reviews.Author: CyberMax
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay a the Hyatt Place because of the good reviews and walking distance to Universal. We have stayed at the Hard Rock twice and decided to save a little money this time around. I read where some reviewers said it was only a 10 or 15 minute walk to Universal. However, the only way you can get there in 10 minutes is if you can run a 5 minute mile. So we drove and paid $15.00 for parking everyday. We also paid for express passes, $110.00 per day which were free when staying at the Hard Rock or other in Park Hotel. So, if you add this up, we really did not save that much and it would have been much nicer and more convenient to stay at one of the hotels in the park. We did like the room and the service, though. I would recommend the hotel to anyone that is looking for a good value and convenient location to drive to many area attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect for Universal trip”
Reviews.Author: hillsindevon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt for 2 blocks of 6 nights, with a trip inbetween to the Hyatt Place Busch Gardens in Tampa for 3 nights. We found our stay to be perfect for our needs. I had done a lot of research before our trip and decided this was the best hotel for us, and was not proved wrong. The staff were always friendly, and happy to help and advise. The breakfast was good, enough for a start in the morning; cereals, fruit, bagels, bread and a toaster, english muffins, pastries and coffee and juices etc and was always well stocked. The pool is small, but adequate; there were never more than a couple of other people there when we went. I visited it 2 or 3 times, but my husband went swimming most mornings. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable with the big bonus being the TV (with HBO), the sofa, and the fridge. The purpose of our stay was to visit Universal and Seaworld parks (not Disney). Obviously we drove to Seaworld, but otherwise we walked to Universal for every trip. It does take 15 minutes and in the heat isn't always a pleasure, but as far as we were concerned quicker than driving and better than paying $12 per day. Even though it does not have a resturant, there is a TGI Friday nearby. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average with some setbacks....”
Reviews.Author: Starbucks98
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was okay, although saying the fruit was "fresh" is a stretch. Cleanliness is questionable, as I found hair in my bed that wasn't mine, along with a separate piece of hair (a dif. color, not mine) on the sink counter. Since we checked in late, they gave us rooms next to the elevator and the ice machine even though we booked a month in advance. Not pleasant. Also, the cleanliness of the couches may need to be addressed. I had a bit of food fall onto it and as I wiped it off, there was this nasty yellow color that came with it. So, just don't use the couches? The location is good for Universal only as it has a free shuttle. For everything else like Disney or Sea World, I wouldn't stay there unless you're renting a car. Disney costs $14 per person on the shuttle, and the whole trip takes about an hour. Add another hour if you're taking Mears to this location from the airport, since it's really out of the way apparently. HDTVs with HBO is a nice bonus, as is the design of the room and mini-fridge. The bathroom doors have been addressed but they really are inconvenient when getting in/out of the bathroom, you have to maneuver yourself around the toilet to shut it. At least TGI Fridays/Cracker Barrel are in walking distance. All things considered, an average hotel but the price is reasonable and the staff are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: JulieSO19
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted of 5 adults. When we arrived checking in was quick and the staff very helpfull, we had an extra person to add to our room thinking we would have to pay extra, but there was no extra charge. The rooms are very big we were on the sixth floor we could see Hogwarts from our window, the beds were very comfortable, fridge was cold, air conditioning quiet, shower constant tempreature, what more could you want. Breakfast was excellent, yoghurt, prepared fresh fruit or whole apples, bannanas, oranges, bread brown and white, bagals, english muffins,3 kinds of doughnuts, porridge, cereals, fresh orange juice, apple juice, milk, coffee and tea another big tick for this hotel. Although we had a car we decided to walk to Universal one morning leaving arounds 8:45 we strolled to the car park in 25 mins, if you leave it any later to leave the heat may put you off. Parking is free at this hotel, all parks range from Â£12 to Â£14 dollars to park and some are cheaper after 6pm Universal is Â£3 after 6pm. We had a great stay and would come back

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are big. All updated. The...”
Reviews.Author: nanis
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big. All updated. The breakfast is a fine.( bagels, cereals, bread, yogurt, and fruit). Rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best "standard room" i have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: wmmdguy21162
Reviews.Content: This was an outsanding value for the money! We paid $98 a night for the standard two bed room during the ever busy spring break. But this just wasn't any standard room. The room was actually two rooms spearated by a half wall.. By the door was a huge sofa that turned into a sofa bed and also contained a wet bar, table and chairs and large ottoman. The window section of the room contained two very comfortable beds, with outstanding linens and pillows that led to a very nice sleep. There was a good sized bathroom, huge vanity outside of the bathroom and a large closet. The TV was a very large flat panel tv (maybe 42") that every electronics you own could be plugged into. The room had all the extra features such as refridgerator, hair dryer, coffe pot, etc. Remeber, this was the STANDARD room. The hotel was very modern and nicely decorated. The lobby was outstanding and almost had a mall feeling to it. The continental breakfast was great with plenty food to chose from. The front staff was very customer freindly and super helpful with anything you needed, directions, tickets, places to eat, etc. Universal is a 15 minute walk directly accross the main highway from the hotel. I would recommend taking the shuttle in the summer because you might die from the Florida heat (just kidding). You can go to City Walk at night and park free I think after 8 or 9 PM. Call them for details. Disney is 15-20 minutes down I-4 which the hotel is right off I-4. The hotel had a very nice outdoor pool and other great features. This is an outstanding value for the money. We could not have been more pleased and wrote very high praise on the Hyatt feedback form.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: taxifor4
Reviews.Content: Just home from a fab 2 weeks in the Hyatt Place,and can't praise the place highly enough.The hotel is perfect if you want to base your self near universal,the hotel runs a shuttle bus but the walk is a plesant 15 mins.The hype surrounding Harry Potter means that the queueing during the day is just too long so we used to go to Universal/IOA around 630 and there is very little waiting time.The breakfast in the hotel is grand and although it can get a bit hectic around 8 30 a little bit of patience and everything is fine.The excellent reception staff were telling be that the hotel is extending their bar facilities in the next few weeks which would be another bonus.While at the hotel we went to the nearby Miller Ale House on Kirkman and Cracker Barrel resteraunt next door to the Hyatt and both were excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Spankytoes
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Orlando and Hyatt made it memorable. The value for what you pay is outstanding. We were a party of 5 with 2 children and booked a 2 bed room. Usually, this means that I will be spending the night on an air mattress on the side of one of the beds. However, the included couch was more than adequate to sleep on. In fact, both of my children wanted to give up their bed our last 2 nights so that they could use it. It was large and comfortable. The room itself is enormous. We had more than enough space to maneuver and spread out. My only real complaint was that the mini fridge was temperamental. It doesnâ€™t do a great job at keeping anything cool. We had water bottles stuffed in there the moment we arrived and they were only slightly colder by the time we checked out 3 days later. If I was nitpicking, Iâ€™d like to see the bathrooms be bigger as well. They run a little on the small side. If I was 6â€™4â€�, I may have felt cramped. Plenty of closet space and drawers for our needs. Also two vanity sinks so that the kids wonâ€™t fight while brushing their teeth. After a long plane ride, and days at theme parks in the heat, this became an amenity itself. The continental breakfast was decent. Several cereals, pastries, biscuits, gravy and juices to choose from. I would have liked a meat product of some sort included, but it wasnâ€™t a huge deal. They do allow you to order a hot breakfast but the prices werenâ€™t very competitive. (I think $6 for eggs and bacon) It can get crowded after 8:00 AM but I never saw anyone denied seating in the designated areas. The location was excellent. There is a CVS, Walmart and several gas stations within a few miles. TGI Fridays is about 100 yards from the front of the hotel. If you walk down the street to the intersection, you are at the gate for Universal Studios. I have to disagree with some here on the walk time. I consider myself somewhat athletic and I donâ€™t think that you could get to the ticket booth in less than 20-30 minutes in the heat with children. (Not the City Walk, the actual gate where you provide your tickets) The hotel has complimentary shuttles that will bring you to and from at stated times. (Get there early if you want to be on the first group) The last pickup time for return was 7:30 PM. A cab from door to door was only $6.00 plus tip with the price including up to 5 people per car. So, if you want to stay earlier or later than what the shuttle allows, this is a cheap (air-conditioned) option for you to utilizeâ€¦especially with tired feet. The staff was outstanding and very accommodating. During breakfast they would ask you how everything was and would go out of their way to make you feel welcomed. If you join the Hyatt Gold Passport program, which is free to do online, they will give you a coupon for 1 free drink per night spent. (Including alcohol) It was nice to leave theme parks where we were paying an arm and a leg to eat and come back to the hotel for a free cold beer when the kids went to sleep. You will also receive complimentary wireless internet. My only complaints about the hotel are minor. First, the pool. Itâ€™s not a bad pool, and certainly not the feature of any trip to Orlando, but it is very small for its location near a major attraction for kids. I know that Hyatt Place is a cookie cutter model, but it would have been nice if they would have expanded the existing pool or added a second to accommodate families during the busy season. The second, and perhaps the biggest thorn in my side, is the elevator. I donâ€™t know if they are possessed or what, but usually taking the stairs is your fastest option. It takes several minutes for the elevator to arrive at your floor on a 6 floor hotel. (And there are 2 elevators) Even if you are the only person in the car, and it will sometimes stop at every floor on the way down. I did notice that it is up for re-inspection in August 2010, so hopefully they will correct this. Overall, I was very happy with my stay and would have no problems recommending the hotel to friends and family. I can see the allure of staying on a Disney/Universal property, but I canâ€™t justify the prices that come with it when a hotel such as this does such a fantastic job at a fraction of the price. We will definitely be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “would return again and again! LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Floridagirl1228
Reviews.Content: This hotel blew others totally out of the water. HUGE clean rooms with comfortable beds and bedding, complimetary breakfast in the morning and the location is perfect. My boyfriend and I (22 and 24) have traveled to Florida many times, and we still talk about how much we loved this place. Got a great deal, and really enjoyed our stay. Happy, helpful staff. If I had to list one con it would be the pool, nothing special. But we weren't there for the pool, we were there for the $4 taxi ride to margaritaville in universal! Overall, would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: elliot52
Reviews.Content: I had read very good reviews on this hotel so when I decided to go to universal I decided I would try the Hyatt.As I was trying to check in,Yoli (general manager) came over to me and asked if she could be of assistence.I said I was there to check in .Yoli brought me over to a terminal and checked me in herself. Yoli then gave me a tour of the breakfast area and other areas in the lower part of the hotel.she also handed me a discount coupon for restaurants and shops in the area.she then showed me how to get to my room.When I went to my room on the sixth floor , I was very pleased.It had a refrigerator, safe , a large screen tv and 2 full size comfy beds.Later I asked if I could stay a little longer before checking out ,the gentleman at the front desk said how long would you like to stay? I have never stayed at a Hyatt hotel before,but with this type of service I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting for traveling with friends, and great value!”
Reviews.Author: taffystay
Reviews.Content: For $60/night on Priceline, I wasn't sure what we were going to get, but we were so pleased and surprised when we walked into our room! We had a small living room area with a sofa bed, partitioned off from the two double beds and bathroom in the other part of the room. It was a perfect space for the three of us. The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The breakfast buffet had sufficient variety (cereal, oatmeal, toast, fruit, donuts), and there were a lot of tables in the lounge/eating area for guests to eat. The purpose of our visit was to go to Universal Studios, and we were able to walk there (about 25 minutes). You can also walk to the CityWalk area. There's a free shuttle to and from Universal and the hotel, but the times are pretty limited. The hotel is about 25 minutes from the airport and costs $45 (the hotel can arrange transportation for you).

Reviews.Title: “Close to Park”
Reviews.Author: jifner
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively close to Universal Studios, but it is still quite a walk to the park. It took about 15-20 minutes to walk from the hotel to the front gate itself at a brisk pace. At the end of the day it is very tiresome. Though there was a shuttle from the hotel, we wanted to get the park earlier than it left so we walked each day. Overall the hotel is like the pictures advertised on the hotel website and is a clean hotel with a modern look to it. The only negative would be the elevator. Compared to the rest of the hotel, the elevator is very dated, worn, and slow. The breakfast was ok, with lots of fruit and cereal choices, but nothing hot. You can pay to order a hot breakfast like an omelet, but I never opted for that. The hotel is quiet off the main road. Bathroom where toilet and shower is really tiny and it is awkward to get in and shut the door with the limited space. Sink is outside the bathroom and the closet is fairly small. There's not really a convenient place to keep your luggage out of the way and I typically don't unpack everything into drawers and like to keep my suitcase out. I finally put it in the corner next to my bed and the outside wall. There is a nice sitting area in the room where another person could sleep if necessary. There is a refrigerator in each room but no microwave. You can, however, use dishes and the microwave in the kitchen/breakfast area of the hotel at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mac514
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on this hotel before we arrived I was slighty worried. It was a great wee hotel with a great location. The reception area was really nice, clean and smelt fresh all the time. We got fresh towels and our room was cleaned everyday. The room was a great size, 2 big beds, a living area with sofa, table and chairs and a fridge. Bathroom was a bit small but in the grand scale of things does it really matter. Swimming pool was small but adequate with towels supplied. Breakfast was included in the price and for what we paid for the hotel this was a bonus. We had a car but used the free bus to universal and got a taxi back early in the afternoon at a cost of $4.00 as the car parking is expensive. Had a meal in Cracker Barrel and TGI Fridays which are both beside the hotel and they were both very good too. Would without a doubt stay in this hotel again and had a great holiday in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: adlufc
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights here upon arriving in Orlando. The hotel was easy to find coming straight from the Airport. Check-In was no problem and we were put into a Handicapped accessible room on the second floor. The room had a touch more space to move about that a normal room with a large and comfortable King Bed. There was an out of sight closet area with a Iron and Iron board. There was a separate sink area that had a empty fridge underneath which we took full advantage of. The sink area was in the main room as opposed to the bathroom but for just a couple this did not represent much of an issue. There was also a hairdryer in the room. The seating area and the HD TV were good to have if travel companions were sleeping but the TV could easily wake other sleeping as the TV did not have much pivot angle on it. Breakfast was fine and had a selection of single serve cereals along with Yoghurts and Fresh Fruit. There was also donuts, bread, bagels and English Muffins along with Cream Cheese and Preserves. Juices, Water and Coffee were also available. If wished you can order a freshly prepared Eggs and Waffles from a select menu. Availability ends slightly later on the weekend. The free wi-fi was also great and available throughout the hotel, you just need to enter your name into a pop-up for 48 hours access. The fitness centre is small with just 2 treadmills, one bike and one cross-trainer and I preferred to take advantage of the weather and train outside but is was hot even going out around 7.30am As previously mentioned the Hotel is very accesible for Universal Studios and would take 15 minutes to walk there. Once over Kirkman Rd the walk is very pleasant through the Universal resort with well maintained pathways etc. I took advantage of this and used it as part of a morning run route. It also felt fine to walk out on an evening to the restaurants/ citywalk area. TGI Fridays is seperated from the hotel by 1 further hotel and is great for families or just grabbing a drink at the bar. We also ate at Millers Ale House along Kirkman road and enjoy the big screens with various sports and the reasonably priced food and drinks offers. The pool was fine for cooling off in but not big enough to exercise. Towels are available outside by the pool. The only negative would be the size as if a number of guests tried to use it, it would get full very quickly but mostly people are at the parks and this will restrict use. The Interstate noise was noticible from the pool area but this will be no worse than at any other hotels in the Orlando area. The hotel is also well placed for the Prime Outlets, Mall at Millenia and the Florida Mall should you wish to hit the shops. Disney as well as the premium outlets are probably about 20 minutes away down the interstate and if Disney was the main part of your visit then I would suggest staying slightly closer to Lake Buena Vista etc. For us who were not doing the parks it was a great choice and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel near Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Ferrazalves
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Universal this time. The hotel is fine, the only con is the bathroom - a bit "too" small, I supose it should add "avoid by clautrofobic" note. But I can put several pro in this hotel. The bed are ok, too bad we got 2 queens, not a king. Complimentary continental breakfast (served until 09:30 am), and complimentary shuttle to US (not necessary - it was a 20 min walk) in the morning (9 and10 am) and return in the afternoon (5 pm), also they offered payed shuttle to disney (14$ per person - if your group is larger it could be cheaper to get a taxi). We learned only on day 2 that we could buy a I-ride ticket and used it to go to other parks and outlets - so we avoid a taxi ride. When I asked about how to go to Prime outlet they told e about taxi only, they "forgot" to tell me that I could get this ticket and used the I ride troley (or bus) in order to get to the outlet. Taking everything in account I would say that it was a good hotel by the cost\offer ratio. That we received a lot - but IÂ´ll stay onsite next time and check the difference.... Ah: there is no restaurant in the hotel, so you have to be ok with "grab in go" stuff (not the best option when you arrive at night after a international flight)

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Kruger_Fred
Reviews.Content: This is without a doubt THE best value for money hotel next to Universal. I managed to get a really good deal through Priceline but I have already booked up directly with Hyatt for October this year. My partner and I were travelling around the USA and during our stop in Orlando it was essential we had somewhere to rest easy and not cost us a lot of money to get around places. Now, first off I will say that if you plan to go to Disney, this hotel is quite a distance from it. We had to get a shuttle which was arranged for us by Hyatt at the cost of $2.50 each way each day. Happily though, the Hyatt Universal is the first pick-up so you get a choice of seats on the bus and you get to Disney within 30 minutes. Universal however is literately across the road. A Lot of people on here have said that you need the shuttle or it is a 25 minute walk but this is simply not true. Even with children this walk will take you 15 minutes at the very most and as Universal is almost instantly within your sights upon leaving the hotel, it gets close very quick. Yes you have to cross a busy highway but there are lights which enable you to cross so I don't get the problem. Upon crossing the road we walked through the car park and within minutes you are in City walk. Very convenient, very quick and unless you suffer from a serious lack of motivation or are just plain lazy, this walk is a breeze. Now back to the hotel. We didn't use it that much but when we did we found a lot of home comfort in having a large HD TV in the room and it was nice to wake up to in the morning and watch ESPN HD. The fridge was incredibly handy and so was the air conditioning unit. I suffer from tinnitus and it is essential I have a gentle humming sound during the night to enable me to sleep, this did the job fantastic. I didn't use the pool but my partner did and she loved it. Yes it was small but there was no-one using it and was nicely lit at night. Within 2-3 mins of the hotel next to the Holiday Inn is a TGI Fridays which we used for our first night at the Hyatt but I would suggest Jimmy Buffett's in City Walk. Staff were excellent, the business centre enabled us to print out directions to our next destination and was always available. Breakfast was a little bland but on the plus side is, it was free and if we wanted something a little bit more substantial, we could order it from the kitchen. I did this once and although a little expensive, it was nice to have some eggs! All in a all, a very convenient hotel for access to Universal and somewhere I would 100% recommend for a comfortable stay with easy access to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JenniferSun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Universal Studios in May. Great customer service. Very friendly and would help you if you needed any thing. Hotel very nice. However off a busy street with the pool directly in front of the parking lot. Not a good idea if someone steps on the gas and does not have the car in reverse. If you just want a hotel to go to Universal you could not ask for better.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: liandjer2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights. The hotel was ok but could do with some improvements. The bathroom was very small with a horrible dirt mark in it (which put us off using it) and the sink wasn't even in the bathroom it was in the bedroom area because the bathroom was too small. The toilet was way too close to the shower there was just no space to move in there. The room service was not up to scratch the room did not get hoovered once whilst we stayed there if you walked on the carpet your feet will end up black within minutes, i ended up walking around with my flip flops on. The location of the hotel states that it is across the road from universal studios... it is not it's about a 25 minute walk. The hotel however do offer a free shuttle service to take you to universal. Also do not stay at this hotel if you are not driving, we was not driving and there was not many places to walk to as the hotel is right next to the motorway which you cannot cross and there are hardly any pavements to walk on. unless you don't mind taking a taxi everywhere, the hotel staff will call one for you. There is free continental breakfast in the mornings which was nice with a wide range of things to choose from and you can also take it up to your room, only downfall is some of the plates and cutlery was dirty, not very nice to put your breakfast on. We ordered the hotel food for dinner. the food was way too expensive and it was horrible i wouldn't advise you to order from there. Overall the staff were very friendly and the room was spacious with a seperate living area and a kitchen area. Just a shame that the room service and cleanliness could of been a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Franbrasilia
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is the best! The room was big, but the beds are too small as the closet. There was mold smell, I think because of the carpet that looked a little old. But the room and bathroom were very clean. The room have a very big tv with cable. Overall, it was a nice stay, except for the mold. I wold stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: I flew to MCO for a job interview the next day. I almost went to Cocoa Beach, but wisely refrained (it was spring break, Easter & the eve of the 3rd to last space shuttle launch; I'm told traffic was abominable). So I went via numerous toll roads to the Hyatt Place. My expectations for any hotel that touts its location as being ACROSS THE STREET FROM UNIVERSAL STUDIOS were low, + I'm a Hilton guy, so I'd never tried Hyatt Place, the lower-end part of the chain. The exterior is plain, not a surprise once you realize that many Hyatt Place properties were once lowly AmeriSuites. But after an efficient check-in in the pleasant lobby and a s-l-o-w elevator ride, I was quite impressed by the suite-style room. The decor is modern, wtih a good desk, wet bar with fridge (which I think is great for keeping water cold), an enormous flat panel tv, adequate bathroom, and nice bed. The tv is situated so it can swivel toward the living room or the bedroom. I very rarely bother with hotel pools, but it was a gorgeous Sunday and I had nothing more pressing than preparing for an interview (!), so I laid out for about 1.5 hours. The pool was small but adequate, with plenty of towels. The view of the parking lot and expressway leaves a bit to be desired, and there were a lot of loud kids, but both dilemmas were resolved with, respectively, closed eyes and an iPod. The in-hotel gym is pretty weak, but as a biz traveler, my expectations for hotel gyms are very low. The area around the hotel is horrid, but then again, it caters to touristas visiting Universal. There's a TGI Fridays very close by, which isn't my game, but it was adequate. There's a Starbucks about 1/2 a mile away. All in all, I liked the hotel. I wouldn't have paid $167 for it, but again, it was a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ggrunloh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights over our spring break. I have nothing but good things to stay. I liked that when you walked in and felt warm and cozy. The mini frig came in hand while traveling with kids. I wish there would have been a microwave. The color schemes though out the hotel are nice. Rooms are cozy, breakfast is decent. Very close to Universal and has a shuttle that runs back and forth twice a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TinaBull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights in Feb 2010. Rooms are HUGE! Separate living area, massive flatscreen tv, fridge, coffee maker. Comfortable beds, good pressure in shower. Service excellent, free wifi and breakfast was good. Not many restaurants within close proximity but most people visiting Orlando have a car. We got a mega cheap rate on priceline and it was a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: TravelGav
Reviews.Content: Good value for money with friendly staff, self check-in and within easy walking distance to Universal - I think it took us about 10 minutes, so you really don't need a car or the shuttle and you get a great view of the Portofino hotel on the way there. The building is a remodelled Amerisuites and looks slightly worn in places. However, the large rooms are bright with plenty of space to relax and free wifi - always a bonus. There was very little noise from the busy roads outside, more noise in fact inside from the bathroom extractor. Complimentary continental breakfast in the lobby was plentiful though it did get busy from time to time so wasn't that relaxing first thing. Two easy dining options - TGI Friday's at the adjacent hotel and Cracker Barrel across the parking lot. A good choice when visiting Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in this area”
Reviews.Author: barney2002
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Only one complaint....left over salad in fridge but hotel employee took care of it and assured me staff would know about it. Small spots on sofa arms that should be easily removed. Housekeeping needs to be alerted to small things. Good breakfast and very nice front staff. Others commented on how nice & lg. rooms were.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: aleticiafb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hyatt to be closer to Universal studios in my trip to orlando. The hotel is really great! Internet, parking and breakfast, all free! It`s a walking distance from universal parks, like 15 min walking. The last time I was at Universal I stayed at Dobletree, is a great hotel either. But everything you have to pay for: parking, internet, breakfast. So, I think Hyatt place is a great choice for those who don`t wanna expend $14 a day to park at Universal Parking and those who don`t bother take a few minutes walking to the park... The room was great. Really nice big TV. But the bad was a little bit small for my husband that has 1,90m. So we ask for a bedroom change and, even been book out, the hotel arragended us another bedroom (accessible) even bigger than the one we were and with a nice king size bed. I really appreciated that, the staff was very atencious to my husband problem! I just was expecting more about the beakfast. I`m from Brazil and I love Wafles and eggs, but you would have to pay for. But, overall, the breakfast is great: breads, bagels, cream cheese, fruits, yogurt, cereals, juices... But no eggs at all... :-( I missed it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LAKTEX
Reviews.Content: Hyatt Place offers tremendous value for money with a really large room and complimentary continental breakfast which is more than adequate. I booked this by mistake as I meant to book at the Convention Center location but as I had a car and it was less expensive it really did not matter. The staff are great and will do anything to help - the only downside is that breakfast is sort of in the reception area - it would be nice if reception were separate. The room had everything you wanted, coffee m/c, fridge, easily controlled air con (bit noisy), great sofa with huge footstool/lounger. Place was quiet and was never disturbed by noise despite being full and at a week-end. No hesitation to book here again. TGI fridays just a couple of minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great night”
Reviews.Author: tourista007
Reviews.Content: I thought the room was great, it was really large, In my King size room there was also a fold out couch that had extra blankets and a comforter in the table on the side. The tv was huge! and they had a great channel selection. The service was good from check in to check out. The breakfast was really good. The location of the hotel is great too, there are a lot of places to eat within walking distance, and there is a large shopping plaza a short drive away. It was a great stay. They also have 2 computers with printer access available at no charge in the lobby which is great if you want to check in for your flight and print out your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Universal”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBleh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location for our long weekend trip to Universal Studios. It is within walking distance of the parks and City Walk, which were the main purpose of our trip. They offer a shuttle service, which is shared with some other hotels nearby, but we never used it. The rooms were a nice size, and it was great to have a fridge in room for keeping beverages chilled. The galley downstairs was equipped with a microwave and plates and glasses for guest use. They also had a 24-hour kitchen. The continental breakfast was nice and included a selection of cereals and breads, fresh fruit, yogurt, juice, milk and Seattle's Best coffee (they had mugs and to-go cups, which was nice). There are a few restaurants very close, including a Cracker Barrel and a TGI Friday's. A steak house, a Japanese restaurant, a Golden Corral and a Carrabas are just a tad further but within walking distance or can be reached via a short cab ride. They have free internet access and printing available in a small "business center." It was only a small room with 2 terminals, but it was not difficult to get on a computer to confirm our flights home and print boarding passes. The best part was the staff. They were all incredibly helpful and a delight. Not a single person was less than wonderful. I would not hesitate to stay here again on a future trip to Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel - Good buy if your looking for a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: spidora2002
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hyatt Place Univeral over Thanksgiving for 5 nights. The sole purpose of our trip was to visit Universal Studios and City Walk. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel just a few tips to offer. If you are looking for a hotel with entertainment or a bar/lounge you may need to upgrade. By no means did I have any complaints concerning this hotel it was just a very basic no thrills hotel. As you enter the hotel there is a lobby area where you register, encompassed in this area is a snack area that offers sandwiches/fruit/water/soda - keep in mind anything you purchase in a hotel will be expensive; a bottled water and soda was I believe was $2.75 not horrible, we ordered cold sandwiches twice late night, again not bad, nice to have this option. There is also a kiosk where you can order food 24 hours. There is one shuttle option in the morning leaving for Universal studios at 8:40am and one in the evening at 6:40pm these are the only times the shuttle leaves and this pick up is at the end of the route so plan on standing the 10 minutes or so that it takes to get to the park. They advertise this park is across the street; this is not necessarily true, yes you can walk but expect at least a 20 minute walk, it really is further than right across the street, and after walking all day it's nice to just relax and get a cab back to your room. Cab rides are about $6.00 one way ; the one thing that I learned is on the way home from the park the cab drivers are not thrilled about taking you the short distance - I guess they loose their place in line for only a $6.00 fair and most of the cabbies lease their vehicles so you will not receive a warm welcome by any means - I almost hated asking but late at night or after a long day I just wanted to be driven back to the hotel. There are a few shuttle return pick up times (I believe 3) during the day but again long lines and you have to adhere to the schedule which we never did. If you miss the free shuttle in the morning the hotel will call you a cab that they contract with, again price is $6.00 that was nice if you wanted to sleep in. We had fresh towels every day, the staff was welcoming, friendly always welcomed us back from our day - no complaints but once you get back to your hotel there really is not too much to do. THere is a counter area where you can order a beer or wine but there is no "bar" or entertainment in the hotel. THere is a TGIF's within walking distance and also a Cracker Barrel Restaraunt besides that there are no close food options unless you take a cab. I personally would opt to spend the additional money and stay on Universal site next time or upgrade to a hotel with more options, unfortuantely with the little options the hotel offers there is not much around the hotel to compensate. We are a 40 year old couple who like to stay up late but also prefer to be close to the homefront so for us this was just your basic come back to the room and sleep. The rooms were nice equipped with a fridgerator, sitting area and a large screen TV, beds were comfortable, dressing/makeup vanity outside of the bathroom - bathroom consisted of a shower/tub combo and toilet. If you are looking for a hotel close by and are on a budget this is definetely a good deal - I would not deter anyone from staying here. There was also a nice complimentary continental breakfast. fruit, juices, bagels in the morning. Do not use a credit card if you order pizza from an outside source at night - pay cash upon delivery - we ordered pizza from a restaurant and it never came and when we tried calling back there was no answer, now this was on a Sunday night and they may have decided to close early but not even a phone call saying they would not be able to make our order - luckily we did not use a credit card. All in all a nice place and good option if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice rooms and great facilities”
Reviews.Author: DrRobert78
Reviews.Content: We always love staying at the Hyatt so in general no big surprises. Rooms were spacious and clean. The hotel has all the important facilities (free internet, gym, pool) One downside is the breakfast. It is served in the lobby and at rushhour you have to stand in line. If you don't like this than there are many great alternatives around (Sizzlers ...etc). The hotel is conveniently located across Universal studios and nearby two big outlet shopping malls (prime and premium outlet shopping).

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the staff”
Reviews.Author: Lorna14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting Universal Studios. Its very close and they provide a free shuttle to the park. We were very impressed with the staff at the Rio who went out of their way to make our stay perfect. The manager and the people we encountered at the front desk really cared about us. Usually, we stay at new hotels, and the facility is somewhat dated, but with the large room, huge flat panel TV and outstanding customer service this is where I will stay next time in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but had a few problems”
Reviews.Author: RaeRae7384
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at this hotel. The room was beautiful and the bed was very comfortable. There was a very nice breakfast in the morning. Here are the problems I had: 1) I called to see if I could check in a little early and the woman I talked to on the phone was very rude and said I couldn't check in until 3 or maybe even later than that (even though check-in time was 3). 2) When I got to the hotel at 3 I was told that there were no rooms available because the carpets were being deep-cleaned and were all still wet. I flew in to Florida at 9:30 in the morning and the heat index that day was 107. All I wanted to do was shower and relax. 3) When they finally found a room for me I got stuck with the handicapped room which, of course, had no tub so when I showered the rest of the bathroom floor was soaked. I was offered no discount for taking a room that I did not reserve. 4) My boyfriend asked about the free shuttle to Universal and we were told that the service was provided by Universal and cost $7 per person for a round trip. We ended up walking and eventhough it looks like the park was close there are fences up all around it. To actually get to City Walk the walk was over a mile. In 107 degree heat the walk was not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncypeacock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. They do not charge for parking, it is a updated hotel, has free continential breakfast. The staff are great. I am attending a conference at the Doubletree. The Doubletree charges for parking and does not provide any breakfast or free internet service so I stayed at the Hyatt. It is only a 5 minute walk on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you don't mind being away from it all”
Reviews.Author: DavidsTravels
Reviews.Content: OK room although it's strange how the sink is in the main room. Air con noisy. Hotel ok for 1 or 2 nights but no more. Lovely flat scrren TV. Nice to have complimentary continental breakfast. The thing that let's this place down is the location - not great so you need a car. The hotel does not look that great from the outside and when we arrived there were people selling chain saws and grass strimmers on the land outside the parking lot. Maybe I'm getting a bit picky as I get older but I was expecting a bit more from Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier. One of my favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: lyau27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights with 4 male friends and myself (a girl). The pictures were exactly like the room, which I am always nervous about, but they were accurate and very nice accomodations. My friend who slept on the pull out couch said it was very comfortable. Staying with 4 guys, the sink being on the outside with an additional wet bar made things very easy in the morning. Beds and pillows were great as was the internet. I read on other reviews that the internet was not good, but I was on the 7th floor and had no problems. Not the fastest, but easy to access and had a decent speed. My absolute favorite part of the hotel was the HUMUNGOUS flat screen tv! Had all the channels I wanted and good proximity to the bed. Overall, the stay was very enjoyable. I'd was definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: KiffyAnn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and have enjoyed myself each time. The rooms are large and modern with a huge TV. Universal Studios is right across the street and a TGIFridays and Cracker Barrel are very close. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: DSHDallas
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Place is across the street from Universal Studios, and they have a free shuttle to the park. The rooms were extremely large and in excellent condition. The living room area was great, as was the small kitchen area with a refrigerator and coffee maker. This was an ideal room for traveling with kids. We now seek out Hyatt Place when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Universal Studio's '09 Vacation”
Reviews.Author: teraHouston
Reviews.Content: I thought The Hyatt Place was a great location if visiting Universal Studios, in walking distance. There are a couple of restaurants near by and of course you can walk to the City Walk. Also the rooms were clean, newly remoldeled and the best part was the wonderful staff, great service and friendly helpful attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Brandy_from_NS
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and modern. Rooms were updated and nice. Big screen tv was very nice. All rooms have double beds (not so impressed). Front desk people super friendly. B-fast was good. Lots of variety and not all garbage carb foods. They had fruit, yoguart, toast, cereal, bagels, & toast. Coffee is Starbucks. Free high speed internet and free parking is a bonus! This hotel is central, but NOT for walking. If you are going to stick to Universal Studios, then this hotel works. Universal is about a 15 min walk. The Outlet shopping center across the street is NOT accessible by foot. It crosses over a major highway and there is no sidewalk. Restaurants (that are decently priced) are not plentiful. TGI Fridays was Ok, and Cracker Barrel was exceptional (great value for your home style cooked meals). We bought passes for the I-Trolly and never got to ride it. After waiting 45 mins for a bus we called a cab. I guess if the trolleys get filled up, they skip the next stops and go to the final destination. So you could be waiting a while if it's busy. As for the "Outlet Malls"....they are a laugh! The Florida Mall was comparable prices and in some cases had better sales!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly pleased”
Reviews.Author: youknowwhoToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Orlando/Universal. I wasn't sure what to expect other than just reading and seeing pictures on the web. The staff were friendly & helpful. The room was big enough for 2 adults and 2 teens. Our dilemma each nite was not knowing what restaurants to go to. The front desk staff were great in recommending restaurants. We tried their recommendations and it was a thumbs up. We would definitely make a return trip to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - and very convenient for Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: HippoPi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from the UK and we stayed here for 4 nights in July, during our month-long trip down the East Coast of the USA. For people from the UK - this hotel was a similar style to a Travel Inn or Holiday Inn Express i.e. clean, functional, lacking character but perfectly comfortable. We didn't have a car, so everything was done by foot or cab. There is a TGI Fridays one minute walk away. A further walk - about 15/20 minutes - takes you to Universal Studios - both the theme parks and CityWalk, with all the restaurants and bars. The walk in pleasant enough, though best early or late in the day (not when it's really hot!). To get elsewhere (e.g. Disney) we got cabs, which reception kindly arranged for us. Both Disney and the airport were around $40 one-way. Staff were very friendly. The free breakfast, unusual in the US, was nice. There was a coffee shop too. Tip - there is a handy giftshop in the Holiday Inn (one minute away), for buying snacks, cigarettes etc). The room was fine, very spacious and well equipped. This was one of the cheapest well reviewed hotels we could find in Orlando and we were very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: iamkarkar
Reviews.Content: Ok, so my boyfriend and I stayed here May 11-17, 2009. This review is a little late, but I can't stop thinking about how great this hotel was for what I paid. And because I got such a great deal on this hotel, I feel like it's only right to thank the hotel by recommending the Hyatt to everyone who might come across this. Thanks to Priceline I got an incredible deal for $30 a night, and boy was it worth it! For 6 nights, the total came to be $212 dollars. Just to reiterate the value in the hotel, that's less than what we paid for 1 day at Disney w/ park hopper for the two of us! ($250) As for the location it could only have been better if we would have actually stayed at one of Universal's three hotels. From the Hyatt we were able to walk to Universal three different times during our trip and figured we had saved at least an additional $30 dollars by not driving across the street and paying the parking fee. Some individuals have complained about the walk being long and dangerous, and have warned others on walking across the street to not do it. I would like to point out that I do not agree. There is a big intersection that needs to be crossed in front of the hotel, but there is a cross walk and a light where you can easily cross at. From there you follow the sidewalk to Universal and are there before you know it. I actually found it an enjoyable way to start our day as we got to see Universal's hotels and many small lizards on our way. We were also not alone on the walk. Many other individuals who were staying at nearby hotels were also walking near us. My travel partner and I are both in our twenties, maybe if we had kids I would think differently, but in my opinion don't be scared, it's really not a bad walk at all! I never once feared for my safety, and for us that was part of the reason of choosing this hotel was the convenience of being able to walk to the theme parks! Back to why I feel like I got such a great deal at the Hyatt, I believe the Doubletree across the street charges a resort fee, parking fee, and internet fee as do many hotels in the Orlando area. The Hyatt did not. I was able to access the internet in our room, purchase theme park tickets, and print them downstairs. Which allowed me to save both time and money. As for the actual hotel, I believe if you plan to spend all your time outside of your room at the theme parks then this hotel is perfect. If you are looking to hang out at the hotel then I would probably suggest something a little more upscale. As for the room, it's decent size, has a refrigerator which is always a plus, nice big flat screen TV, which is also a plus, and big sofa. The hotel room itself is good. As for the rest of the hotel, I would not say this is the most beautiful hotel that I ever stayed it, because it is not. The elevators are slow and annoying so we usually would end up taking the stairs, but I look at that as getting some exercise. The lobby and the food area are not that big. For my taste the hotel is a little small, only 6 or 7 floors, but still for the price I paid I really can not complain. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save money and spend time at Universal Studios. I am planning a trip in October and hoping that I can stay at this hotel again for the rate that I paid in May. Again for a good rate you will be amazed at how much you can get for so little.

Reviews.Title: “Great free breakfast, super nice staff, huge TV in room for ESPN highlights at night!”
Reviews.Author: singergal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our family vacation to Universal -Seaworld-WetnWild-BuschGardens! Love this hotel for many reaons. First off, the staff was always smiling and friendly. The breakfast was free and there were donuts, bagels, cereal, toast, english muffins, fresh fruit, yogurt... Then the TV in the room was HUGE. Although we weren't in our rooms watching TV during the day, at night it was nice to crawl into bed and watch ESPN highlights or a movie! We had 3 busloads of kids staying during the week we were there for a convention and even with all of those people, we were able to get breakfast just fine because the hotel staff (smiling of course) opened up additional rooms for the kids to hang out in for breakfast so that other families could sit at the regular tables. Pool was just a basic pool, but we weren't there to layout by a pool, but rather were gone all day at the parks. This hotel is a moment's drive away from Universal, you could walk it but definitely worth the parking costs to save the energy for the parks. And by the way, the bed was fantastic, very comfy. Even my daughter (12) liked the sleeper sofa just fine. It' has a half wall privacy shield that made it kind of nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Universal,but thats not all you want,is it?”
Reviews.Author: Eppinger201
Reviews.Content: Family vacation to Universal Studios,had a blast!!Drink plenty of liquids,wear sunscreen,and SPEND THE EXTRA ON THE EXPRESS PASSES,ITS WORTH IT!!Thats all I have to say about that. For the hotel we loved the room,with it's compfy beds,sitting area,wet bar,and 42 inch flatscreen! All of the comforts of home when your staying for an extended time with a teenager who needs space to play on his Laptop,a husband who wants to sit on the couch,watch sports,and I to be able to take a nap or in front of the vanity getting ready to go to City walk.The rooms are very well layed out.We are only a family of three,but we have been in many hotels and Its a pleasent change from your typical two hard double beds a chair and table. Staff was very nice,helpful,and welcoming,but the hotel needs to do a better Job with the "Tourist Preying Resturants" who slide menus under your door all hours of the day and night!These resturants have the CRAPPIEST FOOD,take forever to deliver,and yeah good luck getting your money back or anything once they get their hands on your $$! My family and I fell "PREY" to it one night after spending all "Hot" day at the parks and not wanting to go out to eat we ordered from one of the places and as I said "Crappy food",and they didn't bring half of our order which already took them over an hour to deliver so I just wanted my money back I know the delivery guy didn't get to far when I called to complain but it took them almost 3 HOURS to bring my money back! The lady at the front desk helped by calling,and then told me "We tell the guest not to oder from those places" but that headache could have been spared,if we we're told that in advance!Rather than them rushing to charge the incidental fee to our credit card for the entire length of our "PRE PAID" stay upon check in!Which is an inconvience when it is assumed the guest didn't choose that location to stay in their rooms but instead out at the parks.The charge hasen't been credited back to my card yet and the only thing we did was order a movie one rainy night. My overall opinion is that the Hotel is just a stones Throw to Universal Studios,the shuttles are very convient,but if we ever go back to Orlando we would choose to stay at the other Hyatt Place location only because there is more to do around that location such as mini golf,and more resturants for those days we didn't want to go to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Front Desk! Rooms clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Fellow_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: This is the first review of a hotel that I've ever been motivated to write. Everything about this hotel is good. The front desk people went out of their way to be helpful. The beds were clean and comfortable. I enjoyed the HD flat-screen televison and the wireless internet access in the room was perfect. A fantasic hotel at a bargain price. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Went above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: luv22tor
Reviews.Content: My older son and I arrived very late to find that we had been put in the only room left - a handicapped room with a king bed and a pullout. Initially, we were not happy. Surprisingly, my adult son found the pullout to be VERY comfortable. We actually chose not to move rooms the next day because we wanted a full day at Universal. The staff delivered a box with fruit, crackers, water, and chocolate to our room while we were gone, along with a note that they were sorry for the inconvenience. The next morning they gave us a hot breakfast free. Then at the end of our stay they did not charge us for any waters and snacks we had purchased. They offer a continental breakfast, but they also have a full kitchen. You can input an order into the computer - breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks - and it's there waiting for you in a few minutes. The egg, cheese, and sausage burrito for breakfast is easily breakfast for two. Delicious! There is a shutter to Universal, but it only runs three times in the a.m. and twice at night... nothing during the day. But a cab is only 4-6 dollars to get back, and they're lined up at Universal. Seems like walking distance until you do it, which we did... once. Don't. Too long and dangerous (crossing major highways). The pool seems okay - not quite as nice as the picture makes it out to be... but nice. The hotel is nice and quiet. I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel. You will LOVE the staff and the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Great Value plus friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingCarters
Reviews.Content: We had to stay one more night in Orlando that I had no reservations for. We walked in the hotel around 6:00pm on a Monday evening and the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Gave me a great rate and checked us in immediately. I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel, as it was my first time staying at a Hyatt Place. It reminds me of a contemporary Courtyard. We loved having the flat screen HDTV's and modular couches. The room was large and had plenty of space for a family of four to stay several days comfortably, They have complimentary wi-fi and continental breakfast with cereals, fruit and breads. You could order hot food for additional fees that were reasonable. Though we were only here overnight, I noticed that it would have been a convenient location for visiting Universal and other local attractions and the hotel offered a free shuttle to Universal and SeaWorld. There was also TGI Fridays and Cracker Barrel next door that you could walk to. We actually ordered the best flatbread pizza and sandwich from Flippers Pizzeria and they delievered promptly to our room with nice hot food! All in all a great value hotel in a nice location near International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: eagleye33
Reviews.Content: When I say nice, I am not talking about the physical part of the hotel (although it is okay), I am talking about the people that work at the hotel. Every person that we encountered went out of their way to make us feel welcome and appreciated. We spent 10 nights at the Hyatt Place Universal and enjoyed every minute of it. The loacation is great for visiting Universal Studios. It is within reasonable walking distance but they also offer a free shuttle with limited service. They offer a free continental type breakfast, which consist of fresh fruit, bagels, muffins and cereal. The rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable. The only negative that we had was that the closet space is small and drawers and storage space is somewhat limited. There is a small fridge in the room and the flat panel TV was awesome. There is a TGI Fridays and a Cracker Barrell within walking distance also. The pool is small but is clean and well kept. Absolutely would stay here again if we visit the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, very close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: mcl273
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, very clean. We felt safe staying here. We used the hotel's free shuttle to Universal, and were very pleased. Our room had two full beds and a sleep sofa. The split bathroom is great when travelling with teens. The complimentary continental breakfast buffet with Starbucks coffee is a great way to start the day. We hope to return this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrspruett
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the location was terrific(close to Universal). I got used to free Starbucks coffee every morning. The staff makes an extra effort to say "good morning" and make you feel welcome. We had a great time and would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Polite and Attentive Staff!”
Reviews.Author: PixieDustedDisneyFan
Reviews.Content: Every staff member in this hotel said hello to us and was polite and helpful. Upon check in, we received a mini tour of the lobby showing us where the breakfast would be set up the next day, how to get to the pool and so on. We were assigned to a room on the third floor near the elevator and it was very quiet. The elevator you have to take to get anywhere though is old, muggy and the doors are slow to open. Our room was gigantic. I was really impressed with the size. For anyone staying longer than one night, there is more than enough space to stay comfortable and organized. The room itself was clean. I did notice a few issues: 1. The shelf above the "closet" was in need of some dusting and possibly some new paint. It just didn't match the cleanliness of the rest of the room. 2. The bathroom set up was awful. The only light is above the toilet so showering is tough and you have to wait for your eyes to adjust. 3. The drain was a little scary...looked like rust and other build up and didn't have a stopper on it. The bedding was fine, however...not as plushy as regular Hyatt's accomodations, but comfortable. We did not use the pool, order any of the food they offer for sale or use the business center. Our schedule for the day didn't allow us enough time to enjoy the complimentary breakfast in the morning, but the offerings were plentiful and served on nice modern, white dishes. Nothing was served in "to go" containers...a very nice touch! You didn't feel rushed. The location of this hotel as an offsite Universal partner hotel is great. You could walk to the parks if you wanted to. If you are looking to stay at this hotel to experience the Disney parks, plan on driving about 15 minutes to Disney property and then another 10-20 minutes once on property to get into the Disney park of your choice. I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay again if I needed to be on the Universal side of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Thrillseeker504
Reviews.Content: This hotel is better than any other Orlando area I have stayed in so far. Usually, when I travel to Orlando, I try to get the lowest rates on hotels so that I may have more spending money activities. I took my chances for the first time with Priceline's name your price. Great choice. Got the room for $39/night even though others have gotten it for $30, but hey you livng and you learn. $39 was still a great rate for a clean room that exceeded my expectations for the price. Rooms are divided in to living/work area and bedroom. Staff is very pleasant. We were fortunate enough to receive early check-in at 11a on the day we arrived with no hassle. Deborah was very willing to accomodate us. Continental breakfast offers more than others hotels I've visited. Its directly across the highway from Universal Studios, walking distance to restaurants, and a quick drive to shopping. Of course, do not expect the RITZ Carlton, but a very decent hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zpac
Reviews.Content: I just stayed there for two nights but have to offer an overwhelming kudos to the staff... Debra at the Front Desk was absolutely wonderful along with all her other Desk Clerks and Housekeepers... The only people who seemed out of sorts and unfriendly were actually the managers... who seemed to be working at the desk area in the morning during breakfast one day... they didn't know pricing for some items in the cooler display and also were confused about the breakfast supplies... Overall, a very good hotel with a sub par breakfast and what seemed to be bandwidth restrictive internet...

Reviews.Title: “More than just GREAT Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bolduc
Reviews.Content: They went above & beyond just regular customer svc. We stayed for 5nights and everytime we left & came back to the hotel there was someone there to greet us EVERY TIME they even brought up a birthday cake for my son's 10th birthday. We stayed VERY VERY comfortably in our king room w/ 2 kids sleeping on the fold out couch The bathroom was just fine especially for 2 boys a hubby & a girl There's a privacy window in the room so the adults could get dressed not small @ all . The toilet & shower area were a little cramped but who cares you're only in there to SHOWER!!!!!!! We took the moning shuttle and they drives were very informative When we got done @ the parks we took a cab back for like $3.85 or we just waited for the return shuttle @ 4:15 or 7. Pool area had nice plush towels waiting for us outside poolside already that was a major plus TGIFridays was just a walk away all in all we had a great stay THANKS HYATT PLACE STAFF!!!!!!! Oh by the way the Prime outlets are like a 2min drive away WOOHOO & another P.S. the staff @ brkfst was all too helpful they didn't even let us clear our own table when we were done they were just wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Chilln757
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Minutes from the airport and across the street from Universal. We didn't have to rent a car. The hotel shuttle and taxi were sufficient for our needs. The taxi was surprisingly affortable. The room was very clean and staff was pleasant and friendly. The breakfast was simple and seating was limited, so we ate at another location. The air conditioner is located directly beside the bed and is very loud. As a light sleeper it was very annoying but after a long day at Universal, we didn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel close to Universal Studios”
Reviews.Author: Mmmgr2
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night . It was very convenient to Universal and at $31 a bargain hotel . Nice room except the smallest bathroom ever . It was hard to close the door . Minutes To Universal .

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sindelmq
Reviews.Content: I had a family reunion with 18 family members so we chose this hotel because it was close to Universal Studios. We were very pleased with the helpful, friendly staff and the clean hotel rooms. Each room had a large flat screen TV, a mini fridge, desk and a pull out couch. The beds were very comfortable. We took the free bus to Universal and it was very easy coming and going. Oh, and they have a Starbucks and a nice breakfast in the lobby. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: DutchDesire
Reviews.Content: Has a kind of "upper class youth hotel" atmosphere. No restaurant, bar, a lot of self service; has it's pro's and con's. Room was very large (I'm European), TV screen even larger. On the other hand bed and bath were rather small. Background noises (outside, airco?, and inside from refrigerator) during the night. Breakfast basic. Good coffee though.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here every time!”
Reviews.Author: chefshlomo
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough what a wonderful staff they have. They are happy and congenial. I will stay there again if I return!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: iHeartTravel08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Place over Spring Break with my friend and my dad. Although this isn't an excellent hotel, I felt we made a good choice. Pros: -LOCATION! I have to say that this is the best part of the hotel. My dad decided not to go the parks, and in order to save money he just dropped us off everyday. It never took more than 5 minutes to get from the hotel to the parks [even waiting through the long light at Kirkman Rd.)! I recommend using the guest drop-off if not everyone in your party is going to the parks. - The rooms are spacious. We all had plenty of space for our bags, etc. and they were never in the way. -The extra "lounge area" in the room was really nice for privacy. It was just a screen, but it was enough to separate the area from where the beds were. -The television was great! It was pretty big, and it was nice that we were able to make it pivot so everyone could watch. Also, there were many outlets for you to use (for example, someone could hook up their DVD player). -We arrived to the hotel early and I wasn't sure they would allow us to check-in, but it was no problem! Cons: -The bathroom door is so wide that it's a little tricky entering the bathroom. When you open/close it, it almost gets stuck because it comes so close to the toilet. -Our sink was a little plugged. I haven't read any recent reviews to see if other guests have had the same experience, but it was a little annoying. -It's been mentioned here before, but we had an advertisement for a pizza place under our door when we returned to our room one day. Later in the day, we received a letter from the Hyatt staff telling us to ignore the ad because the Hyatt isn't affiliated with the company. -The pool was drained. We were disappointed because we assumed that, especially during spring break, the pool would be open. Overall, I would recommend the Hyatt Place to anyone visiting Universal Orlando. We were at the parks most of the days, and it was a good hotel to come back to to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbel8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and it was a pleasant stay. Overall speaking a quite nice hotel. Rooms are spacious and check-in staff was very friendly. Included breakfast was simple but sufficient for us. The only thing I don't like about this hotel is the noise from the aircondition unit just next to the bed. I am a light sleeper and it really annoyed me at night. If this could be improved then I would definitely stay again. Breakfast area is very small and can get busy in the morning but the good thing is that you could take your breakfast to your room and have a relaxed breakfast there iso in the busy/small breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY! Hyatt Place is great; just not THIS LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeCost
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? I know there are people writing reviews on here whom think this place is great because they are use to staying in Motel 6 and Days Inn, and this is a step up. Don't believe the ratings. I cannot tell you what a disappointment this hotel is. I think Hyatt Place, having stayed at others previously, is a great chain. This hotel must suffer from poor management. If you enjoy being treated like dirt by staff; then by all means stay here. I am one of the easiest people to please; I require little or no attention and will go about my way happily. However, it seems this staff went out of its way to be disrespectful. Here are a few of the highlights: --Dirty dishes caked with moldy food found under couch from prior guest, when I went looking for my son's matchbox cars. --The hallway was filled with pot-smoke as I could hear someone ripping hits on a bong. --The staff unwillingly let us have a 2 hour late check out so as to meet our car-service. The front desk clerk talked down to me "we'll let you stay a couple hours late THIS TIME.....but, first let me check with the housecleaner Maria to see if it interferes with her schedule". (granted I just spent $300+ dollars for a two night stay). --At check in I was basically scared away from any incidentials when the manager made it seem as if buying any would be the most stressful situation in the world. --The guest elevators double as freight elevators so prepare to wait for staff to use them first, guests must wait, staff does not offer you the elevator or make way. --I paid $17.50 for a very small sandwich, two sodas and a vendor size bag of M and M's! at the snack bar. (About $7.00 anywhere else) --The staff cross-talk and banter in the lobby was not appropriate for a family-hotel let alone around customers. If I wanted cussing and infighting between staff I'd paid for the Roach-Trap down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice near Universal”
Reviews.Author: johnsmith47
Reviews.Content: This was our first say and we'll be back. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The decor was first rate, with comfortable beds and a great big screen TV, in room safe, small fridge and a sofa. There was a lot of room. The hotel was quiet even though it was near I-4 and Kirkman. There is shopping further on Kirkman, including a Publix if you want to buy food. My only complaints are that the HVAC fan was too loud and the elevators were very slow. There are 2 PC's in the lobby, but they are often in use. Parking is free. There are a number of restaurants very close by. We'll stay again. There is a fitness center with a universal gym and no free weights, and a small outdoor pool. WiFi was free and worked well. Breakfast was bagels, cold cereal, fruit, yogurt and toast, but coffee was outstanding. There is a bar with beer and wine and snack food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: tourandtravel
Reviews.Content: We (mom and 11 year old) just got back from a 5 night stay with Universal the main focus of trip (also went to Sea World which was an easy drive from hotel). We had 3 requests: high floor (7 floors available), facing Universal and away from the elevator. We were on the 6th floor and facing Universal (caught small amount of fireworks the one night we were in room at the right time), but we were in closest room to elevator without being next to elevator (across the hallway). I did ask about the room location at checkin and they assured me it wasn't next to elevator but across and down the hall..."down the hall" turned out to mean the first door across and 6 steps to the left from the elevator. I should have gone right back down to switch, but I didn't (after traveling all day, I was feeling tired). Anyway, we did get noise (talking/laughing/yelling) from other guests sometimes very late at night and very early in am. They must not have realized those were occupied hotel rooms all around the elevator area! There was also a set of double doors that "separated" elevator waiting area from hall...these were directly outside out doors and cut down on the verbal noise but added clanging door noise when anyone used them. I preferred the verbal noise, so I tried to keep those doors open (and I had a white noise machine...don't leave home without it!). Any noise we did get to our room was short lived and bearable. As another reviewer mentioned, the park does not recognize our Hyatt Place key cards as discounts...one waiter told us we needed to have a card "sleeve" that stated we were at a preferred hotel, not the actual key card. He ended up giving us the discount anyway so we tipped him a bit extra! This was not a big deal to us, in the long run. The complimentary shuttle only works for you if you don't mind going (3 morning x's offered 8:40 10:40 and 11:30 during our stay...along with 1 trip at 6:40 pm for City Walk) or returning ( 2 x's offered 7 and 9:15 pm plus 2 or 3 late night returns for City Walk; midnight and 2am and ??). The schedule is not too convenient but we did use it for 3 trips there and one back, other wise we took a cab back (~6 bucks including tip) and on 2 days we drove and paid 12 for parking, as we knew we would be back and forth a couple times (save first receipt and you have in and out privileges for the day). Yes, bathroom and toilet door are tight and sink/vanity area was nice but if one person is drying hair it is annoying to another that is trying to watch TV! :) More drawer space would also be nice if you have more than one person as there are only 3 medium size drawers...closet space was adequate. After first day our wash clothes weren't replenished, after 2nd day of this (we specifically left note requesting a two) we had NO washcloth left. By 3rd day, washcloth supply was fine! The bathtup was a bit...old? Possibly the one thing not updated when Hyatt took over this property 2 years ago. Otherwise, hotel room was very clean, beds were comfortable and we enjoyed the sitting area with small sofa The breakfast was plenty: fresh fruit, bagels, cereal fits the way we eat on mornings we are trying to get somewhere.
