We did order food one night to supplement our restaurant leftovers. Picky 11YO enjoyed the pizza and the salad was made fresh for us. Not really a "restaurant" but definitely helpful. Received 2 complimentary drink coupons at checkin which were used for wine available at wine/coffe bar...nice touch! We (my sister, too!) used business center for Southwest airlines checkin...no complaints and very convenient. Did not make use of in room internet as I used Blackberry for any minor internet/email needs I had. My sister and her 11 year old stayed at the nearby huge Doubletree at same time and she found their hotel to be a bit inconvenient and more costly. A lot of school groups were there (a lot of kids running around), pool area was always crowded (she came to our small, quiet pool that had more than enough lounge chairs for the few of us using it one afternoon), cost $10 /day for internet, they charged her for parking (didn't even have a car with her...I could park my car at Hyatt Place for free) and they couldn't honor her request for a room facing Universal. The staff at Hyatt Place Universal was helpful and pleasant (don't know what was going on with housekeeping and the washclothes) and anytime I had a question or complaint (billed too much for in room movie) they took care of it. For the price I received, this hotel could not be beat! (I found it cheaper on website other than Hyatt's and they honored that price minus 20%...with tax, that was nearly $56 per night which is unbeatable! "Best Price Guarantee") Better than Hotwire! I prefer hotels with a door separating sleeping from living areas, but for our purposes, this hotel worked out very nicely. If it had been more than the two of us, the space would've been a bit tight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: imap316
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt during the first week of April for a weekend of relaxation with my cousin. The staff was extremely friendly and let us check into the room early as well. We were on the 7th floor right in the center of the building (which gave us a great view of the fireworks at night). The room was very clean and spacious. Beds are really comfortable and the large plasma tv is great as well. I notice other reviews mentioned the small bathroom. Yes, the bathroom door comes really close to the toilet, but there is a vanity area separate, which has adequate space to get ready while someone is using the restroom. Universal is directly across the street, but if you are not wanting to cross the busy 4 lane traffic, shuttles are available, along with taxis (the route we chose) which charge about $6. Overall, we had a great stay and I will definately return next time I travel to Orlando. Thank you to all of the Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Now you see it, now you don't...I'd suggest you just don't!”
Reviews.Author: turtle2009
Reviews.Content: When booking the room, I was advised by the front desk of the hotel that as a Universal Partner Hotel 1) you would receive discounts at selected restaurants and merchandise by presenting room card carrier provided - nope they don't recognize them in the park 2) you could get in at 8:00 am to Universal as a guest of the hotel - nope, park opens at 9:00 am, no exceptions - a fun wait with the kids for over an hour in line 3) there is a pool on site at the hotel - nope, closed for repoairs during spring break week - are they nuts?!? 4) free internet - kind of... connects at 9 mbps... simply not usable 5) in room movies for purchase - to keep the kids happy and get them to sleep... guess what... it is all the fault of the third party provider of the satalite feed that when nyou select "buy this movie" that you loose the feed and you need go downstairs to the lobbu and have the system reset (they don't answer the phone so you can't call - they call the third party - takes 1/2 hour... did this twice before they suggested moving to another room, apparently room 619 has a known problem! Rooms were nice, clean... but there is a definite issue with the running of this place and the training fo the staff... not to mention their corporate deal with Universal

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheSoon2BTraveler
Reviews.Content: We got this room for around 40 dollars a night from hotwire.com and it was the best deal ever! This place has very clean room and a huge 40 inch LG TV! The bed was extremely comfortable and it also has a fridge! The room was also very big, though the bathroom design was kind of kinky, in which they have the sink outside of the bathroom. Also, the bathroom size is very small, but that is okay, because everything else was at its best. We got a room on the six floor, and our view was just amazing. We were there during the christmas/new year time, so every night at around 10 pm, we were able to enjoy the firework shows from universal studios very clearly! Regarding to universal studios, this hotel is located conveniently next to universal studios park; we walked there from our hotel just to save us from the parking fee. (less than a 15 minute walk) Anyway, I would definitely stay here again when I come to Orlando next time. P.S. free internet and free parking = plus

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury--An Absolute Steal”
Reviews.Author: ohhoneyhoney
Reviews.Content: Wow! The Hyatt Place Universal has the most amazing staff. The lovely, Giatta greeted us with huge smiles and genuine enthusiasm upon check-in. Debbie made sure our (free! and delicious!) breakfast went smoothly. Our housekeepers hand delivered shaving cream and bathing caps. The maintenance staff went out of their way to inquire if I was OK while standing outside looking lost. In addition to A+ service, the decor is also lovely; modern with glass and granite and chocolate browns. The aforementioned breakfast was nutritious and satisfying with all the yogurt, oatmeal, cereal, bagels, fruit, juice, milk, and Starbucks coffee you could hope to eat and drink. The pool was out of service, (but honestly it was small anyway). No matter, there was plenty to do. In hotel, there's a fitness room and office area with free unlimited Internet. Outside the hotel, the BF and I enjoyed walking the path to Universal Studios, and we made a couple quick trips by car to Mall of Millenia and I-drive. The only disappointment with this hotel was having to leave. We actually liked it better than the high $$$ Disney Hotel we spent a few days at.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, loved it”
Reviews.Author: fkennedy
Reviews.Content: we had two rooms at the hyatt place near universal, the staff were execellent and the rooms were beautiful. the hotel smelled great and we really loved our stay. we will always stay at this hotel when we go to orlando

Reviews.Title: “Staff was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: wedgeclose
Reviews.Content: Family of four stayed 5 nites I couldn't believe how attentive every single staff person was during our stay. In fact I can say that in all our travels that this staff was far and away the best we have ever seen. It didn't matter what time of day or nite we were in or around the lobby someone was always there to greet us with a smile. The morning breakfast was more than adequate especially since everyone from the manager on down was there to assist in cleaning tables or cooking or whatever needed to be done. Kudos to all of the staff people. The rooms were large and well appointed. Wireless, big screen plasma, refrig, coffee maker. Sofa bed as well as two doubles with a divider made the stay easy. What was puzzelling about the room was the design of the bathroom area?? I know I know its a bathroom....but it really was tiny.....with the sink and vanity outside right in front of the beds....kinda made it difficult for dad with mom and two daughters....not a complaint just a quirk. I would totally reccomend the Hyatt Park Place to anyone with a family visiting Universal or Sea World....very convenient and VERY GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, except for check-in...”
Reviews.Author: MassIS300
Reviews.Content: First the pluses - Awesome location, large rooms, plenty of space, more or less clean, and a little "quirky" (a good thing). Pool was VERY warm as it was heated on a chilly winter evening. Continental breakfast one of the best I've had, featuring star bucks. You could also pay for more "complex" starbucks orders (like my wife's favorite caramel macchiato). Large screen (42") tv was a nice touch. We thought the room was very convenient for a family with kids since the rooms were huge with a divider between bedroom and "living area/sleeper sofa". Now for the negative. Called at 3pm to confirm reservation... was told not a problem. Arrived at 8pm to find out they did not have any king beds left, and was going to be given 2 fulls (NOT acceptable to my wife). I was told this was company policy to overbook the hotels since people canceled frequently. After much frustration, I accepted the room as they claimed I should have my room the second day and they would move my luggage while we were out at the parks. We did this, and made sure we were all packed up after our first night stay. Second room was great, other than the extremely loud bathroom fan, and they threw in complimentary cookies and starbucks vouchers. The staff was very nice, but when they asked if I would return I told them despite their efforts, it's hard to return to a hotel that admitted their practice is to not guarantee the room I booked. If it weren't for this, I would've given the place 5 stars for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: FLABeaches
Reviews.Content: Went to City Walk to celebrate my husbands 50th Birthday. I casually mentioned this to the staff on check in. When we returned from dinner, there was a basket of cookies and candy with a card signed by 'all' the staff (many signatures)wishing him a happy birthday. I have never stayed in a hotel with such delightful and sincere staff members.Our entire experience was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Not this Hyatt Place”
Reviews.Author: donnamurf
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at other Hyatt Place hotels and loved them, so it was my first choice when booking for a convention stay. But, not all Hyatt Place hotels are created alike! First, they gave our room away even though I had confirmed our late arrival and they assured me our room was waiting on us. Second, the hotel is run down, dirty, smells of smoke, and even worse smells of strong chemicals to cover up the smell of smoke. We stopped at the Hyatt Place near the convention center, believing it was the hotel where we were booked and wish that would have been the case. The Hyatt Place near the convention center is in another class. The staff is amazing and helpful and the hotel was beautiful and clean. They were more apologetic about our room being given away than the hotel staff that actually made the mistake. So, if you are booking a trip to Orlando and want to stay at a Hyatt Place, don't choose this one!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller32
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 weeks at this hotel for our summer vacation to orlando. The staff here are very proffessional, and good at what they do, check in was swift and quick. The room was amazing spacious nice furniture, fridge, sink, a desk, sofa, another sink for brushing shaving etc large wardrobe space. The bathroom was also great although a little small but very clean and modern. The room also had a lovely 42inch flat plasma which was great although we didnt use it that much. The beds were very pleasant and extremely comfortable to sleep in. there was no room service but we went wall mart a couple of times and just stocked up on munchies, there were places to eat nearby i-hop was not too far and very inexpensive place to relax unwind and have a meal. the pool was small but it was not busy when i went so it was no bother. There was a shuttle to universal but we walked it generally it took about 10 mins and a lovely walk too! its a basic hotel but it had everything with a bit of style that was needed in the room. i enjoyed my 2 weeks her it was superb!!

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: Indiprin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend with my husband and in laws. Short trip - spent most of the time @ City Walk and Universal Studios. For a trip that required a hotel for sleep only, the Hyatt Place was good. For a true vacation, I don't recommend it. The vanity is right by the bed, so if I used the hairdryer the noise could not be blocked out at all. The bathroom is very tiny (really, 2 people cannot stand in there at the same time). The tv is nice and the beds are comfy - great for relaxing after a long day @ the park. Very close to Universal and decent shuttle service. My only negative with the shuttle was that we had to drive to at least 7 other hotels before we got to Universal when the parking lot for Universal was literally right across the road! If it wasn't for the major road separating us from the parking lot I'd really just walk over - prob would get there sooner. The bus is also very small, but we were one of the first stops so we got seats easily. I'd stay here again for another trip to the parks, but our next trip will be to Disney's Coronado Springs Resort in 2 weeks - we chose to step up a bit so we can enjoy the hotel as well as the parks. Will post a review.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: keenerDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after midnight to find that even though I had paid in advance for a three day stay, they had sold my room on to someone else. From their attitude it was obvious that this was not an unusual event and they sent me across the road to a Holiday Inn. No apology and no comeback. I am still trying to get my money back from them. Avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great staff--and the biggest TV ever!!”
Reviews.Author: VidaliaOnions
Reviews.Content: This hotel and its staff are AMAZING. We were going to use the check-in kiosk but a friendly staffer (a young lady) came and greeted us and offered to help us at the desk. Another staffer held the elevator for me when I was getting luggage upstairs, and the young men at the desk spoke to us every single time we passed. To top it off, the manager, TIM, is one of the nicest, most professional people on the planet. Against the tourism channel's advice, we ordered pizza from a flyer under our door. Over an hour later, when we had trouble getting the pizza and the business was extremely rude, Tim actually talked to them and informed them that they were not welcome on the premises and not authorized to pass out the room flyers. He stepped in and helped us deal with the uncomforatable situation THEN offered to cook us pizzas himself, brought them up to the room, and didn't even charge us. He really saved a bad situation. As for the room, the whole reason we ordered pizza was because we wanted to stay in and enjoy the super nice sitting area, colossal TV, and order a movie off PPV. What a treat after a week-long conference!!! Having the sink area and separate bed area was so nice. We were even able to comfortably invite up a business colleague to join us since we had a sitting area. Oh, and we loved the little bistro that was available 24-7 downstairs--how nice. I LOVE this hotel, and I've stayed in the nicest, most expensive hotels in the country with my travels. Thanks to the great quality and EXCELLENT service, I'd stay here and recommend this hotel ANY TIME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: irem77
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very close to the universal studios - almost walking distance and right in front of the famous outlet centres. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and looking in good shape. The rooms were spacious and modern. We had to change our room due to a problem with the door keys at the last minute and got one of the smallest rooms. Still it was big. Compared to other touristic hotels in the area, it was quite above the average. Definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: daffers16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Double/Double Bed Suite. The room was large enough for a family of five. The queen size sleeper sofa was very comfortable. The room also had a small refrigerator which was very handy and a very nice 42 inch plasma tv, just a little annoying as there were no instructions on how to operate. The Hyatt Place is in close proximity to Universal Studios. We took the complimentary shuttle there, the only disappointment with that was the shuttle was completely full with people by the time it cam to pick up people from Hyatt Place, we had to stand all the way to Universal Studios. However, they do have more then one departure schedule from the hotel and Universal studios. The only other awkward moment was breakfast time, the complimentary breakfast was not all that great! The guest kitchen was rather small for everyone and a limited variety of food to eat. Overall, the Hyatt Place is a great place to stay and offer a little more than other hotels close to Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Mchere23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Place Universal in July for a base to our Orlando experience. The breakfast was small but adequate. The room was fantastic. It was very clean, provided a nice frig. and plenty of space. There were a few extra pillows on the couch than I like, but who cares about that. The staff was extremely friendly. Parking at Universal (as well as Disney and SeaWorld) was about $10. We took the morning shuttle to Universal the one day and then used a taxi to return - it was less than $3! Very easy access to I-4 and all the area attractions. Will definatley recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room, Easy Check-In!”
Reviews.Author: rhoagla
Reviews.Content: Overall great room! The 42" HDTV was a nice relaxing touch after a long day at the park in the sun. The A/C was great. The room was clean, the bathroom was clean, and the beds were sooo comfortable that my wife, 3 boys and I slept right through continental breakfast! (one of the reasons I picked this hotel) Cracker Barrel is right next door so breakfast actually turned out great anyway! The fold out sofa bed was great. My family of 5 was quite comfortable. The check-in can be done at 2 touch-screen kiosks just inside the front door with the credit card you used to reserve the room. Took 2-3 minutes. The refridgerator in the room was so cold that our bottled water had ice chunks in it the next morning. Talk about refreshing!! My only complaints are that check-in isn't until 3pm, and that makes it hard to get over to the park early and then you have to worry about getting back to the hotel to check-in and then get back to the park if you're staying until closing. The shuttle runs infrequently, don't depend on it for your transportation to the park and back. Another complaint is that the bathroom while clean is very very small. You have to balance on one foot over the toilet to close or open the bathroom door. Good pressure and tons of hot water though. The coffee maker was ridiculous, making one cup servings in glass mugs that I refused to use. You know the rule about using hotel glasses... If not, look it up. It's scary. Oh, and there were no plastic wrapped cups. So bring your own cups if possible. Overall I would definitely stay here again. My complaints may sound bad but they were small things. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Parking was very convenient and close by the entrance. I paid $110 with tax at the hotel website and it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: traceytracey
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter, her girlfriend and I were at Hyatt Place for 4/2 â€“ 4/7/08. The staff provides excellent customer service. Thatâ€™s it. Some rooms have more furniture than others. I had a double with too much furniture. I moved the extra furniture out of the way but the room was very cluttered. The bathroom is so small, you can't even close the door if you're not in there a certain way. By the way, none of us are overweight. Oh, the windows don't have screens. (Is that a FL thing?) I don't have young children but I didn't like that. The rooms have refrigerators but they DO NOT HAVE MICROWAVES. If you bought food, you have to bring it to the front desk and ask them to heat it up for you. Luckily, there are good restaurants and diners within walking distance because there is NO ROOM SERVICE and they only have EXTREMELY EXPENSIVE Starbucks-type food that you have to go to the front-desk area and order yourself. (I.e.: I saw a bagel sandwich on the menu that costs $8.00) There are no vending machines and I didn't see any ice machines. You always have to go to the front desk to get anything. We ordered in one night and the food was terrible. If you don't rent a car, don't stay here. You'll need to get food. The only coffee available at the Continental Breakfast is Starbucks. For us Starbucks-intolerant folk, we have to brew our own coffee in the room and bring it down to breakfast. Just so you know, the front desk is quick to tell you they are "directly across the street from Universal Studios and City Walk". Actually, they are directly across the street from the ENTRANCE. It's about a mile to the actual park and while it's scenic, it's not pedestrian friendly. There is a shuttle that runs to Universal/City Walk but if you miss it (because it doesn't run in the middle of the day) a cab ride only cost about $4.00. Also, there is a trolley at the end of the street that will take you to International Blvd. Thereâ€™s a Holiday Inn right next door and a Double Tree two doors down. Then, thereâ€™s a host of hotels and resorts on International Blvd. Even the Motel 6 on International is very nice and comparable to a Holiday Inn. Hyatt Place needs to step its game up because thereâ€™s so much better in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked Hyatt Place”
Reviews.Author: nine23swmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights. There was no electricity the first morning and our room didn't get cleaned the first 2 days, but the staff explained the situation and things improved. Overall, it was a great place to stay. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room and hotel were clean. The room was large and my family of 4 enjoyed spending time just hanging out in the room. Transportation to Universal was convenient and it is also a short walk. If you want to do anything besides Universal or Disney, I would recommend a rental car. The trolley (bus) system is slow and a lot of time wasted waiting. The elevators were the main negative at this hotel. They are extremely slow. I would ask for a room on a lower floor (out of 7).

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: laanvdj11
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. very clean great rooms, great tv, breakfast was enough. we just payed $30 p.n., excellent

Reviews.Title: “Bad! Bad! Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Fanbail06
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice furniture and looks great on the pictures! but boy when you get on the inside of a room its all down hill. When my friend and i arrived the room floor was dirty. It had little specks of something scattered around on the floor. After the floor we went to check out the bathroom, OMG! the tub was a horrible. It was nasty I did not want to take a shower in there. Then we noticed that the AC Unit was leaking. the area of the floor around it was saturated. You could tab your feet and hear the water splashing. We immediately asked for a room change and was told that they were booked for the night. They also said that someone would come and fix the rooms. My friend and I leave and come back like 6 hours later. The floor still and not been cleaned, the tub remained the way it was, and there was a big noisy fan blowing in the room. The fan was just there to dry the floor, they never fixed what was causing the leak. We were forced to spend the night in a nasty room. The next day we got out early and was suspecting that when we returned everything would be cleaned and working in a good fashion. We were shocked to find that the floor was still saturated and the tub was nasty(we know this b/c we put a towel down to take a shower and the towel was still there), and the carpet was still not vacuum. We asked to speak with someone in charge and we asked to move out of that room immediately. By this time we both were sick. We changed rooms thinking everything was going to be good. We were wrong again, the ceiling in the bathroom had mold on it. U would think that I a Hyatt affiliate hotel would be up to par. Not this one. Thank God it was only 2nights for us to stay there. i will never stay at Hyatt Place Universal in Orlando ever again. It is poorly ran and maintained.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential”
Reviews.Author: cutiep
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked 2 nights at this hotels for a girls' weekend out in Orlando. Upon arrival, hotel seemed nice. Staff seemed a little disorganized. We got into our rooms only to find that the room has been PARTIALLY cleaned. Linens were changed, however tub was stained, floors werent vaccumed, and bathroom floor had not been swept nor mopped. Our A/C unit was also leaking. We called to see about getting another room and were told that the hotel was full and that there were no additional rooms available. The maintenance man came to stop the leak, but the carpet took two days to dry. The next day we went out and when we returned, we noticed that the room was not fully cleaned AGAIN. We called the front desk again and they offered to give us another room. We took the other room and it too was poorly cleaned and had mold in the bathroom! This hotel has so much potential in that it has modern decor, large TVs, spacious rooms and a business center with two computers and a printer, however with service and cleaning that is unsatisfactory, I think that business will eventually suffer horribly. Be sure to visit the Premium outlets if you enjoy shopping. Also, I dont know if it was an oversight on my part or not, but the hotel changes linens every 3 days (bed and towels) in an attempt to go green. I had no problem with this effort to save the planet, however, I was unaware and didnt realize until I called to complain about old sheets. Just wanted to give you a head up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: LaRobley
Reviews.Content: What a great deal got lucky with Hotwire. One big spacious room great TV and internet oh and the bed was real comfortable. The only small negative is the AC runs contionusly needs a wall thermostat would stay here again and even pay more then $52.00

Reviews.Title: “close to universal studios”
Reviews.Author: DLtravelers
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet hotel - staff friendly - nice size room and a great tv. There free breakfast is the best. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Best Rooms in a Long Time”
Reviews.Author: rrakoczy
Reviews.Content: The only thing to talk about in regards to this hotel is the rooms. It's what makes this hotel. The rooms are large - suites maybe - with a seperate couch seating area and desk. Even a small seperate kitchen sink area and fridge. There is a large 40-42" plasma TV with digital cable and, yes, about 10 HD channels, including HBO in HD. The bed is amazingly comfortable, gorgeous vanity, clean etc, etc. The only complaint would be that the bathtub/toilet area seems lacking in imagination. Not dirty or old, just boring and lacking the the decor and creativity of the rest of the room. I could go on and on with this place, but suffice to say that I loved this room. It is one of the best hotel rooms I have ever stayed in of the hundreds I've been to. And the price of $59 I found on Hotwire is unbelievable based on what I got. I wish I would've taken pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose”
Reviews.Author: KR50538
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there with my son and god son for their Easter break from school. On route from the airport, the shuttle was dropping off other passengers and I'd seen a HYATT PLACE on International Drive, I thought that was my hotel, but turned out it was not...I was a lil annoyed (with my travel agend) that while the Hyatt Place Universal is close (10min walk from City Walk & Studios) there are really no other conveniences, so once you're in the hotel you better make sure you have enough snacks, etc, cuz aside from what they sell at the hotel (overpriced) you won't have any options... Breakfast was great, cereal and fruit are perfect...My biggest annoyance with the hotel is that they caused me to cancel and re issue the credit card I used for incidentals, because they kept charging my card repeatedly, seemed like every other day for my full stay, even though I was pre paid thru my travel agent. Thankfully I check my charge accounts for any discrepancies diligently I was able to see they charged (as of the last time I checked) 3 times for the full stay totalling over $1200. On another note the rooms were a good size even though I was with two eleven year olds... The bathroom was small, but not annoyingly so...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: KarenLynno
Reviews.Content: We payed $82.00 a night for the first week in April, not shabby considering it was still in the Spring Break window and walkins were paying $122.00. The service was fantastic! The breakfast bar was limited in choices but the fruit was fresh, there was yogurt, oatmeal, cereals and an assortment of breads and toppings as well as juice and coffee. They have a very comfortable lobby and a handy internet room. There are only two things that could make this gem of a hotel better. Hot food on the breakfast bar even if they just alternated two items a day as many places do and more shuttle runs from the hotel to Universal Orlando also I think they should add Sea World and Aquatica to their shuttle runs as well. As we plan to come back and would hate to have to go over to Double Tree to try to get on their shuttle to go to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Pictures looked BIGGER!”
Reviews.Author: g0lfin
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the internet are alot better then when we saw the actual room. The room was a bit small but the nice part was the 42" TV. The Breakfast STOPPED at 9:30 but the selection of cereal, fruits and toast was OK. If you have to order off the menu BEWARE, this location has a very small kitchen and any meals that we purchased from the menu seem to come out cold, over cooked or under cooked! Tried to use the pool, but the pool was not cleaned! Spoke to the "Manager" and she said that they were having problem's with the pool maintence company? I would AVOID not staying at this location and look at staying at the Hyatt Place on International Drive. My wife and I had enough of this hotel and we stayed at The Peabody hotel, which for the extra $ was WELL WORTH IT after staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: vcClt
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during the week and absolutely loved it. I had got a decent deal through priceline for $35 a day (off peak month and off peak days in the week). Great location. One Can walk to Universal and it's very close to International Drive. Very Nice staff, great breakfast. Great interiors and lobby. Rooms are very well done.

Reviews.Title: “DISGRACEFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: MARTINWON
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights during Daytona 500 week 2007 - so we were "stuck" here! Wet bar sink leaked underneath and got our food soaked. Pool had cigarette butts in it. Front lobby was under construction - not mentioned on website or during confirming phone call. Mold was growing on the bathroom shower tiles and we ran out of hot water every morning! Housekeeping was rediculous! Very rude and unapproachable. The last day - the elevator failed to work and we hauled all our luggage down the stairs! Highlight - race was awsome - but the hotel was disgraceful. Hyatt needs to do a better job perhaps overhaul this entire place starting with the help!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: srinatarajan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly due to the price and location (very close to Universal Studios). This a AmeriSuites hotel, remodeled and turned into a Hyatt Place. The room was good looking and clean. But the bathroom wasn't touched by the remodeling effort and is very cramped. We enjoyed the big TV and used the varous input connectors to view our photos and videos from our theme park visit daily. Breakfast area is very poorly designed, it gets crowded very fast, with guests trying to fill their trays and staff trying re-fill the bread, milk, fruit etc. it appeared as if the front desk clerks are told not to make eye-contact with the guests, this was very wierd. There is a small gym room with treadmill, elliptical and bike. It wasn't in great demand and we were able to use it every morning without having to wait.

Reviews.Title: “NIce little place”
Reviews.Author: disneyman
Reviews.Content: Don't go expecting the Hyatt you know. This is a refurbished hotel under the new Hyatt Place name which is meant to be a lesser brand. There were some small things that could be improved. The breakfast buffet is lousy. It has fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, toast and bagels. That's it. There is no variety. It is enough to satisfy you if you are looking to save money, but that's it. You can order a hot breakfast or cinnamon roll and charge it to room. The toaster is lousy....it burns the toast if the setting is too high or forces you to run it through twice to toast it at all which causes lineups to form. The area itself is too small and cramped and there is not enough seating. If they had trays for use perhaps more people would take the food back to their rooms. I found the room quite nice. We had a king, which was quite spacious. The lounge area was comfortable and the tv was awesome. they offered the nfl sunday ticket package for $20. I suggest buying it unless you are a Lions fan. the bathroom was pretty big (perhaps because we had a handicapped accessable room?) It had the sink outside which was nice. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I found the staff acceptable if not perfect. The cleaning was a little less than exemplary but pretty good. The room itself was spotless when we started so maybe we are just pigs. :) The hotel is right at the entrance to Universal...the shuttle was dependable and on time (and free) and you could walk it if you like that kind of thing. There is not much else within walking distance except a TGIF and a Cracker Barrell. If you plan to see the area rent a car as the taxi service really adds up. All in all this hotel deserves a 3 star. Its not "the Hyatt" but its no comfort inn either. We had a discounted rate and if I can find another close to it I will look to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience !”
Reviews.Author: waidz
Reviews.Content: This was quite possibly the worst hotel experience we have had. The first impression was bad enough, with renovations of the entrance and extremely poor customer service from the Front Desk. We had to greet them - no hello, welcome - nada. Next - we were only at check-in informed that all rooms are non-smoking, and if we smoked in the room we would be billed $200. Hungry and arriving on a late flight - the hotel has no room service or in-dining delivery menu or similar. We were thus happy to find a Pizzeria menu under our door. We called the Pizzeria and placed our order at 9:30pm. By 11pm, the food had still not arrived. I called again to be told the food would arrive - it never did. The next day, when I complained about it to the Front Desk - we were told that the Pizzeria is banned from the hotel as they are not a legitimate restaurant, but a man working from his garage ! That same evening we came home quite late from Universal Studios - to find all the guests outside the hotel. Turns out there was a fire alarm and one of the top rooms had flooded. We were stranded outside exhausted for over an hour. No explanation was given by the staff at the hotel - we heard things from whoever went to the Front Desk to ask or those asking the Firemen directly. The rooms itself are reasonable in size, but oddly angled. The 42" HD TV is the only outstanding feature. It does not however make up for the poor customer service and lack-lustre ambience of the hotel in general.

Reviews.Title: “Just a run of the mill hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRVLallover
Reviews.Content: Selected this particular hotel due to its location near Universal Studios. It is not a bad walk at all as long as you go up to Majors Blvd and follow it to Universal Drive. Check is went smooth, with a very pleasant young lady working the front desk. The front desk area is very cramp and this could present problems with more than a couple of people checking in at the same time. The room was clean and respectable looking on arrival. Having been an Amerisuite, the rooms have a decent sized sitting area with an "L" shaped couch and a small desk and chair. There is also a wet bar with sink, small fridge, and coffee/tea maker. Would be nice to have a microwave. The bedroom portion of the room had 2 queen sized beds and a sink/vanity. The closet space is pretty small. A 42" flat screen TV sits between the two rooms and swivels for viewing in either area. A decent selection of channels is offered. The bathroom is very small, but was clean. The hotel offers free WiFi, which at best was spotty with the connection being on and off. I'm not sure if housekeeping even exists in this hotel. To be the environmentally friendly guest, I did not mark the bed linens to be changed or the towels to be changed out. However, the only way I could even tell that housekeeping had been in the room was that the throw pillow was moved back onto the bed. In most hotels, even when not changing out the linens, the beds are made up. Glasses were not exchanged out and the trash was not collected. I usually stay with another chain, but had decided to give Hyatt a try since there was no availability within my usual haunts. I think I will stick with my usual chain from now on. Overall, it's not a bad place for just a place to sleep. The rates were lower than other hotels in the same area for the particular weekend. Just don't expect anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Budget a few more bucks and stay at a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaStickler
Reviews.Content: I must add this experience to the many disappointing ones related to the HYATT chain of hotels in recent years. In my book the HYATT chain of hotels is no longer synonymous with quality. This hotel will suffice if you're simply looking for a place to spend a couple of days. However, if you are someone like me who wants your hotel stay to be "somewhat" of a resort/spa experience while on vacation, then this may not be the hotel for you. The lobby area of the hotel doesn't sport a traditional front desk, and the space is very cramped. I guess this is part of the supposed "updated" decor, but it felt somewhat strange to me. I guess I'll start my critique noting that we were allowed to check-in an hour early. Also on a good note, having a 42" plasma TV in each room is a definite plus, however that's probably where my good comments about the room will end. The decor in the living and bedroom areas have been updated, however they dropped the ball when it comes to the bathroom. I'm no architect, but it doesn't take one to recognize that the bathrooms were NOT part of the renovation, but are original to the previous AmeriSuites Hotel. In addition to being very small, the bottom of the bathtub sported strips of non-slip material that looked as though it hadn't been cleaned in years, as it was soooo dark and dingy. The tiles in the bathroom are definitely from a by-gone era. Talk about dropping the ball--WHY NOT GO ALL THE WAY WITH THE RENOVATIONS??? The HYATT spent no time updating the areas on, nor near the elevators either. It's pretty obvious that this was NOT A TOTAL RENOVATION, but simply an on-the-surface speedy makeover. Definitely NOT A QUALITY RENOVATION. To say that they provide a "continental breakfast" is somewhat deceiving. I've come to expect hotels to at least provide eggs (especially with at a cost of over $100 per night), or at the minimum danish as a part of the breakfast menu. Not so with this hotel. Make plans to pay extra or visit the Craker Barrel or Golden Corral (which are both in the vicinity ) if you'd like such items as eggs, bacon, and muffins for breakfast. Not to mention that due to the limited seating area you may not want to spend too much time eating breakfast anyway. They crammed as many tables as possible in the limited space near the front desk. One can hardly walk between the tables in order to be seated. As a matter of fact, the the front desk actually extends to become part of a breakfast bar, an area with stools where guests can sit and order Starbuck's coffee, or simply eat their breakfast. What a wierd design? Maybe their architect was one of the participants of "Kid Nation". I could have done a better job designing this hotel. On a final note, I didn't find the front desk staff to be very helpful. We asked that they recommend a good restaurant, and not once did they mention that Universal (which was right across the street) has an array of restaurants from which to choose. Instead they suggested "dinner theatres" located in other cities. Thank GOD that we brought along a guide book. I was looking for pamphlets reference things to do in the area, which can generally be found in every hotel lobby. Well, after searching the lobby and not being able to find them I inquired at the front desk. The hotel employee instructed me to follow her to a room, which could only be accessed by punching in a pass code, and there were the local attraction pamphlets. It appears they are moved to that area, where they aren't accessible to the guest, at some point in the evenings. Hummm? Why would they not leave the pamplets in the lobby at all times? What??? The Hyatt must think that eveyone travels with guide books and don't really need the pamphlets. Just another wierd "going-on" at this hotel. My suggestion would be for you to simply BUDGET A FEW MORE BUCKS AND STAY AT A BETTER HOTEL. THIS ONE IS NOT WORTH THE MORE THAN $100 PER NIGHT, unless the draw of the 42" plasma TV (and it's proximity to Universal) is enough for you to overlook the hotels many shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and comfortable place to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Triptaker365
Reviews.Content: This must be my best hotel bargain to date. A clean and quiet suite equipped with a very pleasant workspace, mini-fridge and microwave, a good firm bed, an incredibly polite and helpful staff, hot breakfast, free bottles of spring water upon arrival, free wireless Internet, and free coffee anytime: All for less than what I've paid for parking my car for a day-and-a-half in Boston. My first floor room was very quiet, though I did hear the low rumble of airplanes a couple of evenings. The hotel is just five minutes away from Orlando Airport so a lot of pilots and flight attendants were among the guests. It was good to see many happy families and couples at breakfast time. The hotel has a small, clean exercise room. The TV seemed older, and it is peculiar that only 15 or 20 channels were offered. There is nothing do in or around the hotel. Aside from the breakfast area, there is no other place to eat inside. Several standard franchise dining places are a short drive away. It is strictly a place to sleep comfortably, which I did. On my next trip, I will probably consider paying their normal rates to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRoadwarrior
Reviews.Content: As anyone that has been to Orlando recently you can't get a lot of hotel for $100 per night any longer. We booked the Hyatt Place Universal Studios location for about $100 per night. When we arrived the check in service was good. We did not use the automatic check in but opted for a live body. We arrived on a Sunday at 2pm. They checked us in to a room that was already occupied. The occupants did not lock the door from the inside so we just walked in. Fortunatly they were sleeping in bed and did not see us so we quietly left. WEW! They gave us another room with twin queens instead of the King we wanted. We just did not feel like waiting. The room was a very nice mini suite with a nice seating area with a couch. Nice wet bar area, frige, coffee maker. Nice to have someplace to sit while watching the 42 inch plasma TV instead of sitting on the bed. The dressing area/vanity was nice. The tub/bowl area was kind of small and dark. The decor and rugs were brandee new. The beds and pillows were increadably comfortable, as good as the Hard Rock Hotel. The only complaint I had with housekeeping is they did not exchange the cups and glasses daily. We had to wash our own. They said they did not new ones yet, no big deal. The lobby area was very nice and new with comfortable tables and couches and a snack bar with stools. Breakfast was included and was adequate with cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, coffee and juice. The location was great. We walked to Universal every day which was about a mile. Take the Valet Parking Entrance if you walk it is much shorter. Great exercise and you save $11 parking! Lots of restuarants within a few miles. Overall It was a pretty pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: marioeliz
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews and also seeing the Hyatt name attached to the hotel I went ahead and booked it. Well we checked in around 3:30 which they have an express check-in, in the lobby all you have to do is swipe the credit card that the room is under and it gives you the room keys. Got to the room it was really nice, the HD tv was a big plus but the bathroom was very small. Went to Howl-o-scream so we got back to the hotel at 2:30 a.m. we get back in the room and there was a horrible smell coming from the sink that made the whole room smell really bad. I went to the front desk and they gladly swiched me and my party to another room which was the only time they were friendly. The hotel staff was bad and very rude. Almost everytime I went to the lobby there was always a guest complaining about the hotel or staff. There's a little cafe in the lobby which is a big plus but it took 15 min for anyone to come over and ask me if I wanted anything. For the location it's ok. The room was very nice but the staff was unhospitable so that's why I give this hotel 50/50!!!

Reviews.Title: “All Done”
Reviews.Author: captnbeyond
Reviews.Content: Arrived waiting to see which hotel we would get. The one with complaints about it or a great one. We got the later with a few surprises. Our roon was on the 5th floor next to the elevator which made me a little leary of noise. It proved to be unfounded as I never heard it except for a very faint ding once in a while. The rooms and lobby are finally all finished and nicely done. The room was clean and larger than expected. You are directly across the entrance to Universal and much closer to the Disney Lake Buena Vista entrance than I thought it was. Finally the staff was friendly and helpful with any request we had. A word about that quite elevator though. If your in a hurry don't expect a fast ride. It is on the slow side as is the hot water at times but it does get Hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for visiting Universal”
Reviews.Author: caublb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week recently. The hotel was very nice and had quite a few amenties. Some of things included are free wireless internet, a complimentary breakfast, a 42 plasma tv with HD, a mini refridgerator, and shuttle to Universal. The only small negatives where that the shuttle only ran 2 times in the morning and 2 times at night.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again at Hyatt Place Universal”
Reviews.Author: angelo885
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent six nights at Hyatt Place Universal (Sept. 30th - Oct. 6th) and were very pleased. Loved the decor in lobby and rooms. As previously mentioned, very comfortable beds, large spacious couch to relax on after hitting the parks all day and 42" HD TV a huge plus!! I will agree with another review that the toilet/bathtub area is tight. Continental breakfast did not include hot items (eggs, sausage) you had to pay for, but maybe that was included while construction was going on. Selection was great otherwise to get you on the road. Only glitch we had was our room wasn't made up one day until 5 p.m., but the next day it was done by 10 a.m. Staff was pleasant and accomodating and will definitely stay again, have let friends know about also.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: Samickrl3am
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be the updated Hyatt...all they did was put a big TV in each room. Bathrooms were awful, interior was dated, Limited channels on the TV. Toilets did not flush hardly at all. The rooms were nice sized and spacious...this in an old Amerisuites. The lobby is actually pretty cool, with the electronic check-in, and all the other electronic gadgetry. People were very nice at the hotel. I was always greeted and helped..very good staff. The concept is good....just needs to go further than just the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “BAD”
Reviews.Author: chipirrina
Reviews.Content: I use tripadvisor a lot to plan my holidays, so, as one of the previous reviewers I booked this hotel due to the great reviews I had read. I read about all the refurbishment and it looked great. We were there on august 24 and they were doing work all over the lobby, so that did not look good but we did not care at all as we knew it was going to be like thad. The room "looked" great: new furniture and a big plasma tv. But that was about it. The carpet was bad and the whole thing was DIRTY. I did not look under the beds or anything of the sort, I was not trying to find stuff: I just stepped on it. I stepped on peanuts, cookies... Once I saw that I did looked at the sheets. And there were several hairs in them. I don't mean one or two. I don't know if they had been washed or not, at that point I decided to make up my mind thinking they had been washed and for some reason all those hairs had stayed. The alternative was to sleep over the bed. I decided not to tell my husband about any of it (he was definitely not going to get into the bed otherwise). We went to several hotels in this trip after this and I checked sheets everytime: No hairs at all. So now I am not so sure those sheets had been washed. Next moring we get up and: nice surprise!! No HOT WATER. So we have to head Universal Parks without ha shower. That is not nice. Breakfast was free and not good, but there I have nothing to object since we did not pay for it. I filled the hotel survey commenting all these things but they never got back to me. I did not complain directly to the hotel: we had travelled for 10 hours in the car and I did not feel like going through the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: “For this price you will find something better”
Reviews.Author: Disconildo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for honeymoon and spent a week. Good location near universal and many restaurants (walking distances). Free and safe parking lot. Not friendly front desk and staff. Spacious room, w/ king bed, microwave, old minibar, hair dryer and silent air conditioning. There was a pool, but small. Breakfast included but closed about 9:30 am, as we stayed late at the parks, we didnÂ´t manage to enjoy it. So, no commentaries about it. Our problem was the bathtub blocked up with someoneÂ´s hairs... They gave us the room with the bathtub already dirty and blocked up. For sure, the worst point of this hotel is the elevator system. This is the slowest elevator in the world!! And the worst of all: the maids stayed inside of it w/ a large cleaning car going up and down along w/ the guests.. so there wasnÂ´t enough space for people to get inside in the middle floors. We waited for almost 15 minutes to get down w/ our luggage because the same maid appears twice w/ the same cleaning car.. she should be working instead of being riding on the elevator like a petrified statue. There was only one elevator working at that time. When we read the preview reviews, we didnÂ´t think it was for serious; but as we stayed there, we can confirm: it really bothers. For that price, u find something better. But if u donÂ´t mind taking the stairs, itÂ´s a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the $$$, nice remodel.”
Reviews.Author: saxonkc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here April 2-5, 2007 for our honeymoon. I choose the location so we were close to Universal, which you could easily walk to (about a mile from the hotel) if you want to save on the $10 parking fee. When we arrived it took less than 5 minutes for check in. Our room had been renovated and looked just like the pictures on their website. At the time of our visit, the lobby was still under renovation, and the free breakfast was set up in a very small conference room. For a free breakfast, you can't complain. They had bagels, doughnuts, fresh fruit, juices etc.... My only complaints would be our room was right next to the elevator (which was EXTREMELY slow) so it was noisy most of the day, and housekeeping came very late in the day, after 4pm. Otherwise, it was a very nice room, very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Umm are you sure you all stayed at the same place???”
Reviews.Author: mlj14
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick overnight to Orlando. After reading the wonderful reviews of this property on tripadvisor decided to give it a try. Once I saw the room we were assigned I refused to stay here and found another hotel. The room had been refurbished but it smelled very musty the minunte you opened the door, very dark small bath area. They basically took a cheap motel room added some nice linens and a big t.v. would not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property that will only get better”
Reviews.Author: Muriel12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in early June. I wish my trip had allowed me to stay longer--it was a delightful room. I paid $89 with a AAA discount. As has been mentioned by others, Hyatt is introducing a new label (Hyatt Place). They are buying many existing AmeriSuites and remodeling them. The Orlando staff told me that the complete renovation and name change will take place in late July. Right now, all of the rooms have already been renovated and they are completing the lobby renovation. Breakfast is being held in an older conference room, which was a bit drab. The rooms are fabulous. Mine consisted of a very comfortable king bed, a separate sitting area with modern sectional sofa and very, very nice 42" LG flat panel tv. The sink/vanity area is apart from the actual bathroom which houses the toilet and bath/shower. The bathroom was slightly cramped, but the overall size of the rest of the room made up for it. My only real concern with the room was the awkward window unit ac. It took up a considerable amount of space and was rather large. It seemed strange that Hyatt would be leaving these in place when they are obviously spending considerable sums to update the property. When in Orlando again, I'll definitely stay here. I'll also be looking for other Hyatt Place properties in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: tgonzalez0406
Reviews.Content: We just got back after from our stay in orlando. We were coming from NJ and were not familar with the area. The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly. The rooms were very nice and the 42 inch plasma were nice touches. The continental breakfasts every morning were great and the hotel is across the street from universal. This hotel is around alot of stores but not near the trashy hotels near Wet n Wild and international drive. Our room was very clean. Would defintely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: jgirl74
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel. As other comments, they are remodeling, but it doesn't get in the way of anything. Our room was just like the picture on their website except for the couch not being a sectional. The TV was real nice. My husband never sleeps good in hotel beds and he did have a good nights sleep in their Hyatt Grand plush beds. They have marble countertops and modern looking faucets. The room overall was very modern. We checked in around 9pm on a Friday night and checked out at 9am the next morning so our stay was very short, but I will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Vet's new best bet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nafa
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visit Orlando monthly and often stay a night or two (or 8). We've stayed in just about every conceivable accommodation in the area, from the $20 motor inns on 192 to the finest resorts in the area. This was our first experience with Amerisuites and were a little cautious with booking someplace than our usual stand-by hotel. While there are some exceptional stays on Major Blvd. there have been a few dubious ones. We both agree--this was the nicest, most comfortable stay we've ever had in Orlando. First, I booked our room via the hotel website (rather than a third party--always check both, you sometimes will get a better rate at one or another and if it's through the direct website you can avoid additional fees). The interface was simple, the reservation was guaranteed, and it was quickly handled. At $98 (for AAA members) the rate was very reasonable considering the time of year and location. Our stay was right on the cusp of Spring Break and the property was virtually yards away from the entrance to Universal Studios Resort, right within walking distance. The hotel is tucked away off of Major Blvd. and Kirkman on Caravan Ct. (right behind the long missed Mystery Fun House property). A plus is that the the property is flanked by a TGI Friday's and a Cracker Barrel. They are currently undergoing a change-over from Amerisuites to a Hyatt Place (scheduled to be finished in April 2007). Even though there is construction in the lobby it wasn't obstructive. Actually, it wasn't even really noticeable. The staff was very friendly and very attentive. The desk staff honestly seemed to care about our stay experience, something that too many of the hotels/resorts in the area seem to neglect. And housekeeping was an A++. The room, corridors, all the facilities were immaculate and I would swear they were ninjas--everything was always taken care of but we never saw them. And the room...oh the room! The hotel website had true to life, un-exaggerated images of the room. After the initial shock of the spacious size (advertised as 25% larger than the usual room and they weren't fibbing), the view (an Orlando-phile's dream), and all the wonderful amenities (full sized couch, king sized bed, 42" flatscreen TV), we were pretty instantly relaxed and felt at home. Plus it had the most comfortable bed and pillows yet. My bad back didn't hurt once. We usually bring our own pillows but there were approximately 6 regular pillows and of those we only needed one. And we couldn't get over how clean everything was kept, especially the carpets which passed the white socks test. Now I know that part of the reason for being so over-the-moon about our stay is because that it was recently renovated and there is still a newness and 'honeymoon phase' attached to the hotel, but it honestly an amazing stay. We tried to come up with negative comments but the best we could do is that the elevator ran a little slow. That and the sun rose too early. Other than that it was a truly remarkable stay. Everything about our stay was beyond our expectations and it was just the thing we needed for a short relaxing weekend away. We love our other favourites but this one is moving to the top of our list. If you're looking for close, clean, and comfortable lodging at the doorstep of the Universal Resort without having to pay the resort prices, this is the place. Period. Until next time, -Nafa.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good & very close to Universal”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty good. Pros - *The room was recently remodeled (new carpet smell), large (suite), and have a huge flat screen TV. *The room was very clean with nice firm beds. *The breakfast was better than we had expected based on some of the other reviews. I was not expecting eggs and sausage. *We booked (bid) through Priceline for $45 a night. We had seen this is some of the other reviews and so had made a bid for half the currently advertised price. If you want to book it, choose hotels near Universal at 2 and a half stars. * It's a two minute (10-15 minute walk) drive to Universal Studios, you take Major Ave right into the park. This is the main reason we wanted this hotel. Cons - *Staff at checking seemed bored and disinterested but then again it was midnight when we checked in, so maybe she was having a bad night. *There is some construction still going on in the hotel but nothing that is going to disrupt any sleep. Bottomline - The next time I go to USF and/or IOA I will be coming back here based on the great value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: aikido2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just took a little overnight trip to Orlando to celebrate our 19th year wedding anniversary and stayed at this hotel. Not sure how long they have been in the process of renovating, but the renovations are still going on. However, the hotel is not so bad, there are some things that could still use a little fixing. The only thing we found not so good was the fact that the bathroom sink was on the outside of the actual bathroom and the faucet sits a little too far back, so it's kinda hard to brush your teeth and wash your face. Especially if you are 5"4 or under. There was no microwave in the room, but we did have a really nice fridge. Last but not least, there were no drink machines in this hotel. They did have an ice machine though. Since we couldn't warm our dinner and wasn't able to buy soda or water, I ended up having to drive to the nearest store, which happen to be Walgreens. Aside from that, the location was a PLUS because it's really away from the tourist area, but close enough to get there if need be. The overall condition of the room was good. It was big, roomy and clean. The shower was in decent condition too. The bed was a GRRRReat sleep! The big flat screen TV was awesome and for a free breakfast, it was really good. Hot waffles, sausage patties, scrambled eggs, apple juice, orange juice, cereal, pastries, fruit and of course coffee. The staff was wonderful and very pleasant. From the front desk, to the food staff to housekeeping. For the price, and after the renovations, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's a new hotel”
Reviews.Author: ph7301622
Reviews.Content: This hotel is becoming something new: a "Hyatt Place" hotel instead of Amerisuites. The four open floors have all been renovated and the other floors are all under renovation. The renovations are gorgeous. Nice colours, great beds and sheets, beautiful taps, lights and other fixtures, couches and so on, great leather office chair. HUGE plasma TV about 42". I am writing this on the free high speed Internet connection. Only complaints - there is good but limited storage, OK for any of my trips, except a week in Orlando with the family. There are three drawers, some shelves and a modest closet. The breakfast complaints from before still apply, I am here six more nights so I will be able to tell you if it is a exception or the rule. Seriously consider this hotel if you want to be near Universal. Amazing renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother!!”
Reviews.Author: keeptravelingatl
Reviews.Content: I set up a trip for 28 adults and kids to stay here for New Years Eve. Thought it would be convenient for walking to Universal where we planned to spend the day and night for New Years Eve. When we checked in they took our names, but said they were unabe to give us our room keys. When we came back at midnight they had given 2 of the 8 Prepaid rooms away. Then told us we had to drive to the Amerisuites by the airport. Just what we wanted to do - get on the higway on New Years Eve. It was an interesting and scary drive, many accidents. We Were Not Happy, this is what we were trying to avoid by being able to walk. They accomodated us the following day with a room at the Universal property, so we moved back to be with the rest of our group. After much talk back and forth over the next few weeks they gave us a certificate for a free night stay at any of their Five Florida locations. When I called to redeem my certificate they told me the hotel would be under construction for the date we wanted and we would need to stay at the aiport hotel location which would accept our certificate. So I made my reservation with the approval of the manager at the Airport location. I called back to find out about leaving our car there until we got back from the flight we were taking. We are now told that we can't stay at that location with our certificate, we have to stay at the orginal location which will be under construction. Today, when I called the corporate guest relations, I found out they have a new management company and the bottom line is they really don't care what happened in December/January because they didn't manage it then - The new management (Hyatt) is just as bad as the old. They definitely provide customer No Service!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !!”
Reviews.Author: Lizcro326
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel (8/12/06 Room 712) in a king TCB suite and had a terrible experience. 2 adults and 1 6yr old boy. After reading some mixed reviews of this hotel, I called ahead to express some of my concerns regarding bedding, etc. Debbie, who took my call and greeted me when we arrived later that evening, was absolutely wonderful. I explained to her that I had serious problems with my spine and absolutely had to have a good mattress (no springs, good padding, etc). She told me the manager would be checking on the mattress and there would be sheets, blanket and pillows for the sofa as I requested. We checked in after 7pm. At first glance, the room was wonderful for the price we paid ($62 a night AAA Discount). We were actually considering making this a regular place to stay. The first thing we checked was that the sheets were there for the sofabed. They were not. There also was about a 1/4 roll of toilet paper and no extra pillows. My boyfriend headed down to the front desk and requested the sheets, extra pillows and a roll of tp (Once again, Debbie was great). We then headed out to Universal to catch the last night of the 360 Cinesphere, dinner and a movie (we're passholders). It was my boyfriends birthday. When we returned and settled into our room, the bad experience began. First, the room smelled musty but better than the hallway. We made the sofa bed for my 6 yr old son. It was so uncomfortable, he begged to sleep with us. So we tried puting the mattress on the floor for him. At that point we realized it wasn't the bars on the sofabed it was the mattress itself. Upon turning the sheets down on the king bed, I realized that I could feel all the springs with my hand on the edge of the mattress. When I got into the bed, there was a spring poking me in my ribs and upon looking up there was a huge water stain on the ceiling (hence the musty smell) between the bed and work area. We all slept in some strange positions that night. The toilet ran all night long, but with the door closed and the ac running you could barely hear it. This was kind of ironic considering, the water pressure wouldn't even flush a piece of toilet paper without flushing 3 times. Needless to say we were not very well rested in the morning. I called the front desk in the a.m. for a late 2 pm check out as a Hyatt Gold member. We had intended on spending the day enjoying the pool (we never did use the pool, but it looked clean and the people in it said it was nice ). The person who was at the front desk that morning could use a good lesson in customer service. She told me, "You can have the room until 1 pm, but if we need it, you'll have to clear out." I couldn't believe my ears. What kind of answer is that? We decided to get ourselves together and check out. There were 2 towels for 3 people and eventhough there was a housekeeping cart on our floor, the housekeeper was nowhere to be found for at least 2 hours. So showers for everyone were out of the question. My boyfriend and son got to shower. I called and requested a towel that never came. Then came the straw that broke the camels back so to speak. My boyfriend went in to use the bathroom and the toilet overflowed. I called the front desk immediately to inform them maintenance was needed desperately as the toilet was overflowing and I had to go to the bathroom. The front desk clerk asked me if it was overlfowing onto the floor and I replied no because I had shut off the water to the tank but it was right up to the top of the bowl and I had to go badly and didn't want to leave maintenance a "present" if you get my drift. I was assured someone would be up immediately. Fourty five minutes later, no maintenance, no towel, no shower, no toilet and I was humiliated to have to go the bathroom (poop) in a toilet that what up to the rim with waste water splashing on me but could not hold it not another second. We did see the housekeeper on the way out. He was getting a plunger from a utility room right next to ours and knocking on the wrong door. I could not have been more embarrassed or wanted to leave this hotel faster. When I got to the front desk, I was asked if everything on my bill was correct. I explained that we did not use the safe and the other issues we had with the room. The clerks response was "Sorry." That's it, just sorry. I informed her that I was very upset that I had to go home without a shower and had to poop in an overlfowing toilet. I was absolutely mortified!! Again she repeated "Sorry." I told her at that point that we won't be staying here again and I'll e-mail management about my problems since she didn't seem to give a hoot. She basically looked at me blankly and said nothing. We never got to check out the free breakfast or the pool. At this point, I just wanted to get home and take care of my hygene. Other minor things are, there was only one waste basket in the room, one in the bathroom and no liners. Keep in mind this room has a small kitchenette, seperate living, sleeping and work areas. The curtains are cut short so the ac blows behind the curtains instead of into the room and daylight floods the room at the crack of dawn. We used the deskpad from the work area on top of the ac and leaned it into the window on top of the curtains so air would blow into the room instead of between the window and the curtain. The carpet had several large white stains at the foot of the bed. We never did figure out what it was, we just side stepped that area. The refrigerator didn't keep anything cold, but the room temperature bottled water in your room was a nice touch. When we first got there I couldn't understand what all the bad reviews were about. I felt like we had found a hidden gem right across from Universal and decently priced for the area. After an overnight stay, I get what the bad reviews are about. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: debst
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in early July and found it to be well worth its rate that I paid. (I did use hotwire.) The staff was very helpful and very friendly. The room was very adequate. The breakfast presented was just as good. The location is great for anyone who wants to stay in the Orlando area, including DisneyWorld guests. It has restaurants around it that were good to great! (Denny's, TGI Fridays, Golden Corral) For the money, this place was a great place to stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Racing_fan8
Reviews.Content: As always I was very pleased with my stay at AmeriSuites. I have traveled to Orlando several times in the last few years and have to say, this hotel was the best value I have found. We arrived early hoping to be able to check in and freshen up a little. They didn't think they had a room available, but after checking, they were able to check us in well before normal time. The front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant. The rooms are spacious enough to be able to spread out and not have to sit on the bed to use a computer or eat dinner. The breakfast was very tasty and a bonus after our stay at a hotel in Daytona that didn't provide anything. My only complaint about the entire stay was the air conditioning unit was very noisy making it difficult to sleep if we left it running. I have stayed at AmeriSuites hotels in Chicago many times and for an extended period of time in Charlotte, NC. They are usually my first choice in hotels because I can always count on a pleasant stay at an economical price.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Universal Studios
HotelInfo.Address: 5895 Caravan Court, Orlando, FL 32819
